  "article_text": [
    "in his works on quantum groups and non - commutative geometry , yu .",
    "i. manin defined two products in the category of quadratic algebras . an associative algebra @xmath0 is called _ quadratic _ if it is isomorphic to a quotient algebra of the form @xmath1 , where @xmath2 is the free algebra on @xmath3 and where @xmath4 is the ideal generated by @xmath5 .",
    "let @xmath1 and @xmath6 be two quadratic algebras .",
    "any quadratic algebra generated by the tensor product @xmath7 is determined by a subspace of @xmath8 . since @xmath5 and @xmath9 , one has to introduce the isomorphism @xmath10 defined by the permutation of the second and third terms .",
    "the black and white products were defined by manin as follows @xmath11 since @xmath12 is an isomorphism , many properties of the algebras @xmath0 and @xmath13 remain true for their black and white products .",
    "for instance , the white product of two quadratic algebras is equal to their degreewise tensor product @xmath14 .",
    "therefore , one can apply the method of j. backelin @xcite to prove that the white product of two koszul algebras is again a koszul algebra .",
    "+ koszul duality theory is a homological algebra theory developed by s. priddy @xcite in 1970 for quadratic algebras . to a quadratic algebra @xmath1 generated by a finite dimensional vector space @xmath3 , one can associate the _ koszul dual algebra _ @xmath15 . under this finite dimensional hypothesis",
    ", we have @xmath16 , that is black and white constructions are dual to each other under koszul duality functor .",
    "the main result of manin is the following adjunction in the category of finitely generated quadratic algebras @xmath17 using the general properties of internal cohomomorphisms , manin proved that @xmath18 is a hopf algebra and was able to realize well known quantum groups as black products of an algebra with its koszul dual . for more properties of manin s products for quadratic algebras , we refer the reader to the book of a. polishchuk and l. positselski @xcite .",
    "+ koszul duality theory was later generalized to binary quadratic operads by v. ginzburg and m. kapranov @xcite in 1994 .",
    "this generalization comes from the fact that an operad , like an associative algebra , is a monoid in a monoidal category .",
    "a quadratic operad @xmath19 is a quotient of a free operad by an ideal generated by a sub-@xmath20-module @xmath21 of @xmath22 , the part of weight @xmath23 of @xmath24 .",
    "let @xmath19 and @xmath25 be two quadratic operads .",
    "a quadratic operad generated by the tensor product @xmath7 is determined by a subspace of @xmath26 . since @xmath27 and @xmath28",
    ", we need a map from @xmath29 to @xmath26 . in the binary case ,",
    "ginzburg and kapranov mentioned in @xcite two maps @xmath30 and @xmath31 and defined the black and white products for binary quadratic operads as follows .",
    "@xmath32    when the operad @xmath19 is a binary quadratic operad generated by a finite dimensional @xmath20-module @xmath3 , they defined a _ koszul dual operad _ by the formula @xmath33 , where @xmath34 is the dual representation twisted by the signature representation . as in the case of algebras , they proved that @xmath35 and they showed the adjunction @xmath36 in the category of finitely generated binary quadratic operads .",
    "+ from the properties of black and white products for associative algebras and binary quadratic operads , a few natural questions arise . where do the functors @xmath37 and",
    "@xmath38 conceptually come from ?",
    "is the black or white product of two binary koszul operads still a koszul operad ?",
    "can one do non - commutative geometry with an operad of the form @xmath39 ?",
    "one can also add : is it possible to recover classical operads as black or white products of more simple operads ? can black and white products help to describe the natural operations acting on cohomological spaces ?",
    "the aim of this paper is to answer these questions .",
    "+ let us recall that koszul duality theory of associative algebras and binary quadratic operads was extended to various other monoidal categories in the last few years .",
    "the following diagram shows these monoidal categories were koszul duality holds .",
    "they are represented by the name of their monoids .",
    "@xmath40 \\ar@{>->}[dr ] & \\textrm{non - symmetric operads } \\ar[d]^{\\sigma } & & &    \\\\   & \\textrm{operads\\ \\ }   \\ar@{>->}[r ] \\ar@{>->}[d ] & \\textrm{colored operads } \\\\ &   \\textrm{dioperads } \\ar@{>->}[d ] & \\\\ &   \\textrm{properads } & } \\ ] ] koszul duality for dioperads was proved by w.l .",
    "gan in @xcite , it was proved by p. van der laan in @xcite for colored operads and by the author for properads in @xcite .",
    "properad _ is an object slightly smaller than a prop which encodes faithfully a large variety of algebraic structures like bialgebras or lie bialgebras , for instance ( see appendix a for more details ) .",
    "we would like to emphasize that the koszul dual that appears naturally , without finite dimensional assumptions , is a comonoid ( coalgebra , cooperad , coproperad , etc ... ) .",
    "see section  [ koszul duality pattern ] for more details .",
    "+ to answer the first question about the conceptual definition of the functors @xmath37 and @xmath38 , we introduce a new notion of category endowed with @xmath23 coherent monoidal products .",
    "we call it _ @xmath23-monoidal category _ in section  [ 2-monoidal category ] .",
    "this definition generalizes previous notions given by a. joyal and r. street in @xcite in the framework of braided tensor categories and by c. balteanu , z. fiedorowicz , r. schwnzl and r. vogt in @xcite in the framework of iterated monoidal category and iterated loop spaces .",
    "all the examples given above are monoids in a @xmath23-monoidal category . in a @xmath23-monoidal category , we define the functors @xmath37 and @xmath38 by universal properties .",
    "this allows us to define white products for monoids presented by generators and relations in section  [ maninproducts ] .",
    "since the koszul dual is a comonoid , we define a black product for comonoids presented by generators and relations .",
    "( this notion is introduced and detailed in appendix  [ categorical algebra ] ) .",
    "+ the white product defined here coincides with the one of yu .",
    "i. manin for quadratic algebras @xmath41 , with the one of ginzburg - kapranov for binary quadratic operads @xmath42 and with the one of r. berger , m. dubois - violette and m. wambst @xcite for @xmath43-homogenous algebras .",
    "note that the white product is defined without homogenous assumption .",
    "therefore , one could apply them to non - homogenous cases . in this sense",
    ", it would be interesting to study the properties of the white products of artin - schelter algebras @xcite .",
    "+ under finite dimensional assumptions , the twisted linear dual of the koszul dual cooperad gives the koszul dual operad defined by @xcite . using this relation , we define a black product for operads in section  [ manin products for operads ] .",
    "we do several computations of black and white products and show that some classical operads can be realized as products of simpler operads .",
    "all these examples are products of koszul operads and the result is again a koszul operad .",
    "this fact is not true in general and we provide a counterexample in section  [ counterexample ] .",
    "whereas this property holds for associative algebras , it is not true here because the functors @xmath38 and @xmath37 are not isomorphisms . + we extend the adjunction of manin and ginzburg - kapranov and prove that @xmath39 is a hopf operad . since operads are non - linear generalizations of associative algebras , the notion of hopf operad can be seen as a non - linear generalization of bialgebras .",
    "hopf operads of the form @xmath39 can provide new examples of `` quantum groups '' , in the philosophy of @xcite .",
    "this adjunction also allows us to understand the algebraic structures on tensor products or spaces of morphisms of algebras .",
    "for instance , it gives a description of the structure of cohomology spaces .",
    "+ non - symmetric operads are operads without the action of the symmetric group .",
    "one can symmetrize a non - symmetric operad to get an operad .",
    "( it corresponds to the functor @xmath44 in the diagram above ) .",
    "the image of a non - symmetric operad under functor is called a _ regular _ operad .",
    "we define black @xmath45 and white @xmath46 square products for regular operads as the image of black and white products of non - symmetric operads in section  [ bw square ] . in the case of binary quadratic regular operads ,",
    "the black square product given here corresponds to the one introduced by k. ebrahimi - fard and l. guo in @xcite ( see also j .- l .",
    "loday @xcite ) .",
    "we prove the same kind of results for regular operads and square products than the ones for operads and manin s products .",
    "+ the adjunction for black and white square products allows us to construct natural operations on the chain complex defining the cohomology of an algebra over a non - symmetric ( regular ) operad .",
    "the example of associative algebras is very classical . since the introduction of this ( co)chain complex by hochschild in 1945",
    ", it has been extensively studied .",
    "m. gerstenhaber proved in the sixties that the cohomology of any associative algebra is endowed with two coherent products : the commutative cup product and a lie bracket .",
    "this structure is now called a _ gerstenhaber algebra_. ( gerstenhaber also used this lie bracket to study deformations of associative algebras .",
    "this led to the work of kontsevich on deformation - quantization of poisson manifold thirty years latter ) .",
    "in homotopy theory , there is a topological operad , formed by configurations of disks in the plane and called the _ little disks operad _ , whose action permits to recognize two - fold loop spaces . in 1976 , f. cohen proved that the operad defined by the homology of the little disks operad is equal to the operad coding gerstenhaber algebras .",
    "therefore the hochschild cohomology space is an algebra over the homology of the little disks operad .",
    "this surprising link between algebra , topology and geometry led deligne to formulate the conjecture that this relation can be lifted on ( co)chain complexes , that is the singular chain complex of the little disks operad acts on the hochschild ( co)chain complex of an associative algebra .",
    "this conjecture was proved by several researchers using different methods . in the present paper , we take a transversal approach .",
    "we prove that deligne s conjecture holds for a general class of operads and is not specific to the case of associative algebras . using manin s products ,",
    "we construct operations on the chain complex of any algebra over an operad of this class .",
    "( to be more precise , finitely generated binary non - symmetric koszul operads form this class ) .",
    "since these operations verify the same relations than the ones on the hochschild ( co)chain complex , deligne s conjecture is then proved with the same methods .",
    "+ since the white square product is the koszul dual of the black square product , we can compute the koszul duals of operads defined by black square product .",
    "the first example is the operad @xmath47 defined by m. aguiar and j .- l .",
    "loday in @xcite . using the explicit description of its koszul dual and the method of partition posets of @xcite",
    ", we prove that it is koszul over @xmath48 , which answers a conjecture of aguiar - loday . actually , with the same method",
    ", we show that the families @xmath49 , @xmath50 and @xmath51 , @xmath52 are koszul over @xmath48 .",
    "these families provide infinitely many examples for which deligne s conjecture hold over @xmath48 .",
    "+ appendix a is a survey on the notions of operads and properads .",
    "appendix b yields a categorical approach of algebra with monoids and comonoids ( ( co)ideal , ( co)modules ) .",
    "+ unless stated otherwise , we work over a field @xmath53 of characteristic @xmath54 .",
    "in this section , we define the general framework of _ 2-monoidal category _ verified by the examples studied throughout the text .",
    "the notion of 2-monoidal category given here is a lax and more general version of the one given by a. joyal and r. street in @xcite and the one given by c. balteanu , z. fiedorowicz , r. schwnzl and r. vogt in @xcite .",
    "we recall briefly the definitions of _ monoidal category _ , _ lax monoidal functor _ and _ monoid _ in order to settle the notations for the next section .",
    "we refer to the book of s. maclane @xcite chapter vii and to the article of j. bnabou @xcite for full references on the subject .",
    "a monoidal category @xmath55 is a category @xmath56 equipped with a bifunctor @xmath57 : @xmath58 and a family of isomorphisms @xmath59 for every @xmath0 , @xmath13 and @xmath60 in @xmath56 .",
    "these isomorphisms are supposed to verify the pentagon axiom . for every object @xmath0 in @xmath56 ,",
    "there exists two isomorphisms @xmath61 and @xmath62 compatible with @xmath63 .",
    "let @xmath55 be a monoidal category .",
    "the cartesian product @xmath64 is a monoidal category where the monoidal product @xmath65 is defined by @xmath66 .",
    "the unit is @xmath67 .",
    "the associative isomorphisms are given by @xmath68^{(\\alpha_{a , a ' , a''},\\ , \\alpha_{b , b ' , b '' } ) } \\\\ ( a,\\ , b ) { \\boxtimes}^2 \\big((a',\\ , b'){\\boxtimes}^2 ( a'',\\ , b'')\\big ) = \\big ( a{\\boxtimes}(a'{\\boxtimes}a''),\\ , b{\\boxtimes}(b'{\\boxtimes}b '' ) \\big).}\\ ] ] the other isomorphisms are @xmath69 and @xmath70 .",
    "let @xmath71 be a monoidal category .",
    "a _ monoid _",
    "@xmath72 is an object @xmath73 of @xmath56 endowed with two morphisms : an associative _ product _ @xmath74 and a _ unit _ @xmath75 .",
    "a _ lax monoidal functor _ is a functor @xmath76 between two monoidal categories @xmath77 such that there exists a map @xmath78 and a natural transformation @xmath79 for every @xmath80 in @xmath56 .",
    "this natural transformation is supposed to be compatible with the associativity and the units of the monoidal categories :    *   : for every @xmath0 , @xmath81 and @xmath82 in @xmath56 , the following diagram is commutative + @xmath83^{\\varphi_{a , a'}{\\boxtimes}_{\\mathcal{b}}id \\ } \\ar[r]^{\\alpha^{\\mathcal{b}}_{f(a ) , f(a ' ) , f(a '' ) } } &    f(a){\\boxtimes}_{\\mathcal{b}}\\big ( f(a ' )   { \\boxtimes}_{\\mathcal{b}}f(a '' ) \\big )   \\ar[d]^{id { \\boxtimes}_{\\mathcal{b}}\\varphi_{a ' , a '' } } \\\\",
    "f(a { \\boxtimes}_{\\mathcal{a}}a ' ) { \\boxtimes}_{\\mathcal{b}}f(a '' )   \\ar[d]^{\\varphi_{a{\\boxtimes}_{\\mathcal{a}}a ' , a '' } }   &   f(a){\\boxtimes}_{\\mathcal{b}}f(a'{\\boxtimes}_{\\mathcal{a}}a '' )    \\ar[d]^{\\varphi_{a , a'{\\boxtimes}_{\\mathcal{a}}a '' } }",
    "\\\\   f\\big ( ( a { \\boxtimes}_{\\mathcal{a}}a'){\\boxtimes}_{\\mathcal{a}}a '' \\big )    \\ar[r]^{f\\left ( \\alpha^{\\mathcal{a}}_{a , a ' , a''}\\right ) } &   f\\big(a { \\boxtimes}_{\\mathcal{a}}(a ' { \\boxtimes}_{\\mathcal{a}}a'')\\big ) . } \\ ] ] *   : for every @xmath0 in @xmath56 , the following diagram is commutative @xmath84_{l^{\\mathcal{b}}_{f(a ) } }   \\ar[r]^{\\iota { \\boxtimes}_{\\mathcal{b}}f(a ) }   & f(i_{\\mathcal{a}}){\\boxtimes}_{\\mathcal{b}}f(a ) \\ar[r]^{\\varphi_{i_{\\mathcal{a } } , a } }    & f(i_{\\mathcal{a}}{\\boxtimes}_{\\mathcal{a}}a )   \\ar[d]^{f(l^{\\mathcal{a}}_a ) }    \\\\ & & f(a ) .    } \\ ] ] the same statement holds on the right hand side .",
    "the purpose of the definition of lax monoidal functors is to preserve monoids .",
    "[ produitdemonoides ] let @xmath85 be a lax monoidal functor and let @xmath86 be a monoid in @xmath56 .",
    "the image of @xmath73 under @xmath76 is a monoid in @xmath87 .",
    "the product @xmath88 is defined by @xmath89 and the unit @xmath90 is defined by @xmath91      motivated by the examples treated in the sequel , we define a general notion of category with two compatible monoidal products .",
    "lax 2-monoidal category _ is a category @xmath92 , such that both @xmath93 and @xmath94 are monoidal categories and such that the bifunctor @xmath95 is a lax monoidal functor with respect to the monoidal products @xmath96 and @xmath97 .",
    "the last assumption of the definition describes the compatibility between the two monoidal structures .",
    "the next proposition makes it more explicit .",
    "[ def : lax 2-mono ] a _",
    "lax 2-monoidal category _ is a category @xmath92 , such that both @xmath93 and @xmath94 are monoidal categories .",
    "these two monoidal structures are related by a natural transformation called the _ interchange law _",
    "@xmath98 where @xmath0 , @xmath81 , @xmath13 and @xmath99 are in @xmath56 .",
    "this interchange law is supposed to be compatible with the associativity of the first monoidal product @xmath57 , that is    @xmath100^{\\varphi_{a , a',b , b'}{\\boxtimes}id   } \\ar[r]^{\\alpha^{\\boxtimes}_{a{\\otimes}a ' , b{\\otimes}b ' , c{\\otimes}c ' } }    &   ( a{\\otimes}a'){\\boxtimes}\\big ( ( b{\\otimes}b ' ) { \\boxtimes}(c{\\otimes}c ' ) \\big )   \\ar[d]^{id{\\boxtimes}\\varphi_{b , b',c , c ' } } \\\\",
    "\\big ( ( a{\\boxtimes}b){\\otimes}(a ' { \\boxtimes}b ' ) \\big){\\boxtimes}(c{\\otimes}c ' ) \\ar[d]^{\\varphi_{a{\\boxtimes}b , a'{\\boxtimes}b ' , c , c ' } } & ( a{\\otimes}a'){\\boxtimes}\\big ( ( b{\\boxtimes}c ) { \\otimes}(b'{\\boxtimes}c ' ) \\big )   \\ar[d]^{\\varphi_{a , a ' , b{\\boxtimes}c , b'{\\boxtimes}c ' } }   \\\\   \\big ( ( a{\\boxtimes}b){\\boxtimes}c     \\big ) { \\otimes}\\big ( ( a'{\\boxtimes}b'){\\boxtimes}c '     \\big )   \\ar[r]^{\\alpha^{{\\boxtimes}}_{a , b , c}{\\otimes}\\alpha^{{\\boxtimes}}_{a ' , b ' , c'}\\ }    & \\big ( a{\\boxtimes}(b{\\boxtimes}c ) \\big ) { \\otimes}\\big(a'{\\boxtimes}(b'{\\boxtimes}c ' ) \\big ) , } \\ ] ]    where @xmath101 is the associativity morphism for the monoidal product @xmath57 : @xmath102 . + there exists a map @xmath103 such that for every @xmath0 and @xmath81 in @xmath56 , the following diagram is commutative @xmath104_{l^{\\boxtimes}_{(a { \\otimes}a ' ) } } \\ar[r]^{\\iota { \\boxtimes}id }   & ( i{\\otimes}i ) { \\boxtimes}(a{\\otimes}a ' ) \\ar[r]^{\\varphi_{i , i , a , a ' } }   & ( i{\\otimes}a ) { \\boxtimes}(i{\\otimes}a ' )   \\ar[d]^{l^{\\otimes}_a { \\boxtimes}l^{\\otimes}_{a ' } }    \\\\ & & f(a ) .    }",
    "\\ ] ] the same statement holds on the right hand side .",
    "the proof is a straightforward application of the definition .",
    "[ tenseur de monoides ] let @xmath105 be a lax @xmath23-monoidal category .",
    "consider two @xmath57-monoids @xmath73 and @xmath43 in @xmath56 .",
    "their @xmath106-product @xmath107 is a @xmath57-monoid .",
    "it is a direct corollary of definition  [ def : lax 2-mono ] and proposition  [ produitdemonoides ] .    motivated by the example of braided monoidal categories , a. joyal and r. street gave the first notion of a category endowed with two compatible monoidal products in @xcite . in their definition ,",
    "the monoidal categories are non - necessarily strict but the interchange law is supposed to be a natural isomorphism .",
    "this last condition forces the two monoidal products to be isomorphic .    in order to model @xmath108-fold loop spaces , c. balteanu , z. fiedorowicz , r. schwnzl and r. vogt introduced in @xcite the notions of _ @xmath108-fold monoidal",
    "category_. their notion of @xmath23-fold monoidal category is , in some sense , a lax version of the one given by joyal and street since they do not assume the interchange law to be an isomorphism .",
    "but they require the monoidal structures to be strict and the two units are equal .    in the definition of a lax @xmath23-monoidal category",
    ", we do not ask the monoidal structures to be strict .",
    "the two units need not be isomorphic . and the interchange law is not an isomorphism .",
    "therefore , the notion given here is a lax version of the one of joyal - street and the one of balteanu - fiedorowicz - schwnzl - vogt .",
    "the definition of lax @xmath23-monoidal category was suggested by our natural examples , that we make explicit in section  [ examples of 2-monoidal categories ] .",
    "working in the opposite category , we get the dual notion of _ colax @xmath23-monoidal category_. finally , we call a _ @xmath23-monoidal category _ a category which is both lax and colax @xmath23-monoidal",
    ".    a _ comonoid _",
    "@xmath60 is a monoid in the opposite category .",
    "it is endowed with two morphisms : a coassociative _ coproduct _ @xmath109 and a _ counit _ @xmath110 .",
    "a _ colax monoidal functor _ is a functor @xmath76 between two monoidal categories @xmath77 such that there exists a map @xmath111 and a natural transformation @xmath112 this natural transformation is supposed to be compatible with the associativity and the units of the monoidal categories .",
    "explicitly , these compatibilities are given by the reversed diagrams defining a lax monoidal functor .",
    "the purpose of the definition of colax monoidal functors is to preserve comonoids .",
    "[ images de comonoides ] let @xmath85 be a colax monoidal functor and let @xmath60 be a comonoid in @xmath56 .",
    "the image of @xmath60 under @xmath76 is a comonoid in @xmath87 .",
    "[ def : colax 2-mono ] a _ colax 2-monoidal category _ is a category @xmath92 , such that both @xmath93 and @xmath94 are monoidal categories and such that the bifunctor @xmath95 is a colax monoidal functor .    a category @xmath113 is a colax @xmath23-monoidal category if it is endowed with natural transformations , called _ the interchange laws _ , @xmath114 verifying the same commutative diagram than the one defining a lax @xmath23-monoidal category , with the maps @xmath115 replaced by the maps @xmath116 .    [ produit de comonoides ] let @xmath105 be a colax @xmath23-monoidal category . consider two @xmath57-comonoids @xmath73 and @xmath43 in @xmath56 .",
    "their @xmath106-product @xmath107 is a @xmath57-comonoid .",
    "it is a direct corollary of definition  [ def : colax 2-mono ] and proposition  [ images de comonoides ] .",
    "2-monoidal category _ is a category @xmath113 , such that both @xmath117 and @xmath118 are two monoidal categories and such that the bifunctor @xmath95 is a lax and colax monoidal functor .",
    "a _ strong 2-monoidal category _ is a @xmath23-monoidal category where the bifunctor @xmath119 is a strong monoidal functor , that is the interchange laws are isomorphisms .      in the this section",
    ", we study the relation between the composition product @xmath57 and the hadamard product @xmath120 in the category of @xmath20-bimodules and in the subcategories of @xmath20-modules and @xmath53-modules .",
    "these notions are recalled in appendix  [ alg - op - properad ] .",
    "[ prop : examples 2-mono ] the categories @xmath121 , @xmath122 and @xmath123 endowed with the hadamard tensor products are 2-monoidal categories .",
    "the first one is a strong 2-monoidal category and it is a full sub-2-monoidal category of the second one , which is a full sub-2-monoidal category of the last one .",
    "* in the first category , the two monoidal products are equal , that is @xmath124 .",
    "the interchange laws are given by the twisting isomorphism @xmath125 .",
    "* in the category of @xmath20-modules with @xmath126 , @xmath127 the first interchange law @xmath128 map comes from the well defined natural map @xmath129     \\right)_{{\\mathbb{s}}_l } & \\\\   & \\downarrow & \\\\ & \\displaystyle \\left ( \\bigoplus_{i_1+\\cdots + i_l = n } v(l){\\otimes}_k \\big(w(i_1 ) { \\otimes}_k \\cdots { \\otimes}_k w(i_l)\\big){\\otimes}_{{\\mathbb{s}}_{i_1}\\times \\cdots \\times { \\mathbb{s}}_{i_l } } k [ { \\mathbb{s}}_n ]   \\right)_{{\\mathbb{s}}_l } \\bigotimes & \\\\ & \\displaystyle \\left ( \\bigoplus_{i_1+\\cdots + i_l = n } v'(l){\\otimes}_k \\big ( w'(i_1 ) { \\otimes}_k \\cdots { \\otimes}_k w'(i_l)\\big ) { \\otimes}_{{\\mathbb{s}}_{i_1}\\times \\cdots \\times { \\mathbb{s}}_{i_l } } k [ { \\mathbb{s}}_n ] \\right)_{{\\mathbb{s}}_l}=\\\\ & ( v\\circ w ) { \\otimes}(v'\\circ w')(n).&\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] the other map corresponds to the transpose of this one .",
    "it is well defined on invariants instead of coinvariants .",
    "since we work over a field @xmath53 of characteristic @xmath54 , we use the classical isomorphism between invariants and coinvariants to fix this . * in the last case , which includes the two first , the interchange law map is the direct generalization of the one written above .",
    "its explicit description is + @xmath130   \\otimes_{\\mathbb{s}_{{\\bar{l } } } } \\big ( v{\\otimes}v'\\big)({{\\bar{l}}},\\ , { { \\bar{k}}})\\otimes_{\\mathbb{s}_{{{\\bar{k } } } } } \\otimes_{\\mathbb{s}_{{\\bar{l } } } } v ( { { \\bar{l}}},\\ , { { \\bar{k}}})\\otimes_{\\mathbb{s}_{{{\\bar{k } } } } } k[{\\mathbb{s}^c}_{{\\bar{k},\\ , \\bar{\\jmath } } } ] \\otimes_{\\mathbb{s}_{{\\bar{\\jmath } } } }   w({{\\bar{\\jmath}}},\\ , { { \\bar{\\imath } } } ) \\otimes_{\\mathbb{s}_{{\\bar{\\imath } } } } k[\\mathbb{s}_n ] \\right)_{{\\mathbb{s}}_b^{\\textrm{op}}\\times { \\mathbb{s}}_a } { \\otimes}&\\\\ & \\bigoplus_{n\\in \\mathbb{n}^ * } \\left ( \\bigoplus_{{{\\bar{l}}},\\ , { { \\bar{k}}},\\ , { { \\bar{\\jmath}}},\\ , { { \\bar{\\imath } } } } { k}[\\mathbb{s}_m ]   \\otimes_{\\mathbb{s}_{{\\bar{l } } } } v'({{\\bar{l}}},\\ , { { \\bar{k}}})\\otimes_{\\mathbb{s}_{{{\\bar{k } } } } } k[{\\mathbb{s}^c}_{{\\bar{k},\\ , \\bar{\\jmath } } } ] \\otimes_{\\mathbb{s}_{{\\bar{\\jmath } } } }   w'({{\\bar{\\jmath}}},\\ , { { \\bar{\\imath } } } ) \\otimes_{\\mathbb{s}_{{\\bar{\\imath } } } } k[\\mathbb{s}_n ] \\right)_{{\\mathbb{s}}_b^{\\textrm{op}}\\times { \\mathbb{s}}_a}=&\\\\ & \\big ( v { \\boxtimes}w\\big ) \\otimes   \\big ( v ' { \\boxtimes}w'\\big ) ( m,\\ , n ) . &",
    "\\end{aligned}\\ ] ]    note that the first map preserves the shape of the underlying graph of the composition , whereas the second one does not .",
    "therefore , this interchange law map is injective but not an isomorphism .",
    "the reverse natural transformation @xmath131 is given by the projection on pairs of composition of @xmath132 based on the same 2-levelled graph ( see [ properads ] ) .",
    "to such pairs , it is straightforward to associate an element of @xmath133 .",
    "this map is the transpose of the first one .",
    "it is the composite of an epimorphism with an isomorphism , therefore it is an epimorphism .    in the same way",
    ", we can also show that the underlying category of non - symmetric operads , @xmath134-props @xcite , dioperads @xcite , colored operads are @xmath23-monoidal categories .",
    "we refer to @xcite section 5 and to @xcite section 9 for surveys of these notions .      in this section ,",
    "we define the notion of _ bimonoid _ that generalizes the notion of _ bialgebra _ in any lax @xmath23-monoidal category .",
    "+ let @xmath135 be a lax @xmath23-monoidal category .",
    "proposition  [ produitdemonoides ] shows that the category of @xmath57-monoids , denoted by @xmath136 , is a monoidal category for the monoidal product @xmath106 .",
    "a _ bimonoid _ is a comonoid in the monoidal category @xmath137 .",
    "the examples of the categories @xmath138 , @xmath122 and @xmath139 endowed with the hadamard tensor products , give the following notions .",
    "* in the case of @xmath53-modules , we find the classical notion of _ bialgebras_. * in the case of @xmath20-modules , we find the notion of _ hopf operads_. we refer the reader to the recent preprint of m. aguiar and s. mahajan @xcite for a study of _ hopf monoids _ in the category of species which is a very close notion .",
    "* in the case of @xmath20-bimodules , this generalizes the notion of hopf operads to properads .",
    "we call them _ hopf properads_.    when @xmath140 is a hopf operad , the category of @xmath140-algebras is stable under the tensor product(see [ alg - op - properad ] ) .    let @xmath140 be a hopf properad . the tensor product @xmath141 of two @xmath140-gebra is again a @xmath140-gebra .",
    "the proof is straightforward .",
    "we work in the abelian monoidal category @xmath142 of dg-@xmath20-bimodules ( see appendix  [ alg - op - properad ] ) . a monoid in this category",
    "is called a ( dg-)_properad_. since the abelian monoidal categories of differential graded vector spaces and dg-@xmath20-modules are abelian monoidal subcategories of dg-@xmath20-bimodules , the sequel includes the cases of ( dg-)associative algebras and ( dg-)operads . in the following of the text , we will implicitly work in the differential graded context without writing `` dg '' , for the sake of simplicity .",
    "we use a very general language since most of what follows can be generalized to another examples ( colored operads , non - symmetric operads , for instance ) .",
    "denote by @xmath24 the free properad ( monoid ) on @xmath3 and by @xmath143 the cofree connected coproperad ( comonoid ) on @xmath3 ( see appendix  [ alg - op - properad ] for more details ) .",
    "+ the koszul dual coproperad is usually defined by the top homology groups of the bar construction .",
    "the purpose of this section is to prove that the construction of the koszul dual can be described with a pure categorical or algebraic point of view .",
    "this section is a generalization of section @xmath144 of e. getzler and j.d.s .",
    "jones preprint @xcite .",
    "let @xmath145 be a _",
    "quadratic data _ , that is @xmath146 . since the underlying @xmath20-bimodule of the free properad @xmath24 and the cofree connected coproperad @xmath143 are isomorphic , we consider the following sequence in @xmath20-bimod @xmath147    a quadratic data will be written @xmath148 or equivalently @xmath149 .",
    "to such a sequence , we can naturally define a quotient properad of @xmath24 and a subcoproperad of @xmath143 ( see appendix  [ generatedby ] ) .",
    "the _ quadratic properad generated by @xmath3 and @xmath21 _ is the quotient properad of @xmath24 by the ideal generated by @xmath150 .",
    "we denote it by @xmath151 .",
    "the _ quadratic coproperad generated by @xmath3 and @xmath152 _ is the subcoproperad of @xmath143 generated by @xmath153 .",
    "we denote it by @xmath154 .",
    "for example , the quadratic coalgebra generated by @xmath155 is equal to @xmath156    we proved in @xcite corollary 7.5 that when a properad is koszul , it is necessarily quadratic . therefore , there is no restriction to study only the quadratic case .",
    "koszul duality theory comes from homological algebra , when one tries to find small resolutions ( minimal models ) of algebraic structures ( associative algebras , operads , properads , colored operads , for instance ) .",
    "+ the koszul dual cooperad of an operad @xmath140 is defined by the top homology of the bar construction @xmath157 ( see @xcite section @xmath158 and @xcite section @xmath144 ) . in @xcite section 7",
    ", we used the same idea to define the koszul dual coproperad of a properad .",
    "the purpose of this section is to prove that the koszul dual coproperad is a quadratic coproperad and to prove the dual statement .",
    "+ let @xmath159 be a quadratic properad . recall from @xcite section 4 that the _ bar construction _",
    "@xmath157 of @xmath140 is the chain complex defined on @xmath160 by the unique coderivation @xmath161 which extends the partial composition of @xmath140 .",
    "dually , the _ cobar construction _ of a coproperad is the chain complex @xmath162 , where the differential @xmath163 is the unique derivation which extends the partial composition coproduct of @xmath164 .",
    "+ when @xmath159 is a quadratic properad , it is weight graded .",
    "denote this grading by @xmath165 . in this case",
    ", the bar construction of @xmath140 decomposes with respect to this grading .",
    "the part of weight @xmath165 of @xmath166 begins with @xmath167 let @xmath168 be its top homology group @xmath169 and @xmath170 . using @xmath171 , we proved in @xcite proposition 7.2 , that @xmath172 is a subcoproperad of @xmath173 .",
    "+ dually , let @xmath174 be a quadratic coproperad .",
    "it is a connected coproperad , that is weight graded and such that @xmath175 .",
    "once again , its cobar construction is the direct sum of subcomplexes indexed by the weight @xmath176 define @xmath177 to be the top homology groups of the cobar construction of @xmath164 , that is @xmath178 .",
    "since @xmath179 , @xmath177 is a quotient properad of @xmath180 .",
    "let @xmath145 be a quadratic data .",
    "denote by @xmath181 the image of @xmath21 in @xmath182 and by @xmath183 the quotient of @xmath184 by @xmath185 .",
    "the koszul dual coproperad of @xmath186 is equal to @xmath187 .",
    "dually , the koszul dual properad of @xmath188 is equal to @xmath189 .",
    "therefore , we have @xmath190 and @xmath191 .",
    "the cobar construction of @xmath164 has the following form @xmath192 where @xmath193 stands for the sub-@xmath20-bimodule of @xmath194 composed by graphs with @xmath195 vertices indexed by elements of @xmath196 and just one vertex indexed by an element of @xmath197 .",
    "the image of @xmath163 is the kernel of the cokernel @xmath198 of @xmath163 . since @xmath177 is a quotient properad of @xmath199",
    ", @xmath200 is an ideal monomorphism . from the shape of @xmath201",
    ", we see that the image of @xmath163 is made of graphs indexed by @xmath202 with at least one subgraph graph in @xmath203 . therefore , the image of @xmath163 is equal to the image of @xmath204 , that is the ideal generated by @xmath185 by proposition  [ ideal - caracterisation ] of appendix  [ alg - op - properad ] .",
    "we dualize the arguments ( in the opposite category ) to get the dual statement .",
    "the last assertion is easily verified .",
    "a properad is called a _",
    "koszul properad _ when the homology of its bar construction is concentrated in top dimension , that is when @xmath205 .      to an @xmath20-bimodule @xmath73 ,",
    "we associate its linear dual @xmath206 .",
    "the linear dual @xmath207 of a coproperad @xmath208 is always a properad : define the composition product by the formula @xmath209 .",
    "but we need a finite dimensional assumption on the underlying @xmath20-bimodule to have the dual result .",
    "the main explanation for such a phenomenon is that there exists a map @xmath210 , which is an isomorphism when @xmath3 and @xmath211 are finite dimensional vector spaces .",
    "an @xmath20-bimodule @xmath73 is _ locally finite _ if for every @xmath212 and @xmath108 in @xmath213 , the dimension of the module @xmath214 is finite over @xmath53 .",
    "[ coproperad->properad ] when @xmath3 is a locally finite @xmath20-bimodule , the linear dual of the quadratic coproperad @xmath215 generated by @xmath3 and @xmath152 is the quadratic properad @xmath216 , where @xmath217 .",
    "the image under @xmath207 of the terminal object ( see appendix  [ generatedby ] ) @xmath218 & { \\mathcal{f}}^c(v ) \\ar@{->>}[l ] \\ar@{->>}[ul ] & \\ar@{>->}[l ] \\ { \\mathcal{c}}(v,\\ , { \\overline{r } } ) \\ar@/^/[ull]_{0}}\\ ] ] gives the initial object of    @xmath219^{0 } \\ar@{>->}[dr ] \\ar@{>->}[d ] & & \\\\",
    "\\left({\\mathcal{f}}^c(v)/{\\mathcal{c}}(v,\\,r)\\right)^ * \\ar@{>->}[r ] & { \\mathcal{f}}^c(v)^ * \\ar@{->>}[r ] &   { \\mathcal{c}}(v,\\,r)^*.}\\ ] ]    since @xmath3 is locally finite , we can identify @xmath220 with the free properad on @xmath221 : @xmath222 .",
    "( the ( co)free ( co)properad on @xmath3 is given by a direct sum of particular tensor powers of @xmath3 ) .",
    "therefore , @xmath223 is isomorphic to the orthogonal of @xmath21 , that is @xmath224 .",
    "we conclude by the uniqueness property of the initial object .",

    "in the case of finitely generated associative algebra , it is the definition given by s. priddy @xcite . in the case of binary quadratic operads , v. ginzburg and m. kapranov ( @xcite section @xmath23 ) defined a twisted koszul dual operad by the formula @xmath227 , where @xmath228 .",
    "the reason for this lies in quillen functors which are the bar and cobar constructions between @xmath140-algebras and @xmath172-coalgebras ( see @xcite and @xcite section @xmath23 ) .",
    "the bar construction of a @xmath140-algebra @xmath0 is the cofree @xmath172-coalgebra on the suspension of @xmath0 , that is @xmath229 . in general , we have @xmath230 we define the _ suspension _ operad by @xmath231 , with the signature action of the symmetric group .",
    "actually , @xmath232 is equal to the operad of endomorphisms of @xmath233 , that is @xmath234 .",
    "we have @xmath235 . up to suspensions , @xmath236 is the cofree `` @xmath237-coalgebra '' on @xmath0 .",
    "the operad @xmath140 is koszul if and only if @xmath172 is koszul , which is also equivalent to @xmath237 is koszul .",
    "the aim of this section is to provide a general and intrinsic framework for the definitions of manin s black and white products .",
    "we first give the conceptual definition of manin s white product of monoids in any lax @xmath23-monoidal category .",
    "then , we dualize the arguments to get the notion of black product of comonoids in any colax @xmath23-monoidal category . + we make explicit all the constructions in the category of @xmath20-bimodules .",
    "but they remain valid in general @xmath23-monoidal categories with mild assumptions ( existence of the free monoid , cofree comonoid , for instance ) .",
    "these constructions also hold for non - symmetric operads ( see section [ bw square ] ) and colored operads , for instance .",
    "we denote the vertical connected composition product of @xmath20-bimodules and the hadamard horizontal tensor @xmath238 by @xmath106 , to lighten the notations .",
    "v. ginzburg and m.m .",
    "kapranov mentioned in @xcite a morphism of operads @xmath239 `` which reflects the fact that the tensor product of an @xmath24-algebra and an @xmath240-algebra is an @xmath241-algebra '' .",
    "we describe and extend this map @xmath38 to a more general setting .",
    "let @xmath242 be a lax @xmath23-monoidal category such that @xmath243 admits free monoids .",
    "there exists a natural morphism of monoids @xmath244 .",
    "let @xmath3 and @xmath211 be two objects in @xmath56 .",
    "there is a natural map @xmath245 . using proposition  [ tenseur de monoides ]",
    ", we know that @xmath246 is a monoid for @xmath57 . by the universal property of the free monoid on @xmath7 , there exists a unique morphism of monoids @xmath38 which factors the previous map @xmath247_{u_v{\\otimes}u_w }   \\ar[r ] ^{u_{v{\\otimes}w } } &    { \\mathcal{f}}(v{\\otimes}w ) \\ar@{-->}[d]^{\\exists ! \\phi } \\\\   & { \\mathcal{f}}(v){\\otimes}{\\mathcal{f}}(w).}\\ ] ]    @xmath248    * when @xmath56 is the category of @xmath249-modules , the map @xmath38 is the direct sum of the isomorphisms @xmath250 induced by the twisting map . * in the category of @xmath20-modules , the map @xmath38 corresponds to the injective morphism of operads @xmath251 mentioned in @xcite . * for @xmath20-bimodules ,",
    "the previous construction gives a morphism of properads between the free properad @xmath241and the hadamard product @xmath246 .",
    "once again , this map is always injective but not an isomorphism in general .",
    "one remark before to conclude this section .",
    "the purpose of this paragraph was to show that the definition of the map @xmath38 is canonical and does not depend on the bases of the modules involved here .",
    "now , if we choose a basis for the free operad , for instance , we can make the map @xmath38 more explicit . in this case , the image of a tree @xmath252 with vertices indexed by elements of @xmath7 under @xmath38 is the tensor product of the same tree @xmath252 with vertices indexed by the corresponding elements of @xmath3 with the tree @xmath252 whose vertices are indexed by the corresponding elements of @xmath211 .      in this section",
    "we define the white product for every pair of properads defined by generators and relations .",
    "when the two properads are quadratic , the resulting white product is again quadratic .",
    "since an associative algebra is an operad and an operad is a properad , this construction summarizes what can be found in the literature . in the case of quadratic associative algebras",
    ", it corresponds to the original notions introduced by yu .",
    "i. manin @xcite and in the case of binary quadratic operads , it corresponds to the definitions of v. ginzburg and m. kapranov @xcite .",
    "+ the properties of the morphism @xmath38 lead directly to the definition of the white product . let @xmath140 and @xmath253 be two properads defined by generators and relations , @xmath19 and @xmath25 . and denote the projections @xmath254 and @xmath255 .    consider the following composite of morphisms of properads @xmath256 since it is a morphism of properads , its kernel is an ideal of @xmath241 .",
    "it is the ideal generated by @xmath257 in @xmath241 .",
    "let @xmath19 and @xmath25 be two properads defined by generators and relations .",
    "the quotient properad @xmath258 is called the _ white product of _ @xmath140 and @xmath253 .",
    "the definition of the white product of two properads shows that the morphism @xmath38 factors through a natural morphism of properads @xmath259 . in the abelian category @xmath20-bimodules ,",
    "@xmath260 is the image of @xmath261 .",
    "hence , it is a monomorphism .",
    "@xmath262^(0.45){\\phi } \\ar@{->>}[drr ] & { \\mathcal{f}}(v ) { \\otimes}{\\mathcal{f}}(w)\\ \\ar@{->>}[r]^(0.6){\\pi_{\\mathcal{p}}{\\otimes}\\pi_{\\mathcal{q } } } & { \\mathcal{p}}{\\otimes}{\\mathcal{q}}\\\\ & & { \\mathcal{p}}\\circ { \\mathcal{q}}\\ar@{>->}[u ]",
    "_ { \\bar{\\phi}}}\\ ] ]    let @xmath0 be a @xmath140-gebra and @xmath13 a @xmath253-gebra , since the tensor @xmath141 is a @xmath263-gebra , we get the following result .",
    "[ tensor - white ] the tensor product @xmath141 is a gebra over the white product @xmath42 .",
    "[ exemples hom(c , a ) ] let @xmath140 and @xmath253 be two operads .",
    "the tensor product of a @xmath140-algebra with a @xmath253-algebra is a @xmath264-algebra .",
    "we can partially dualize this statement .",
    "let @xmath60 be a @xmath253-coalgebra and @xmath0 be a @xmath140-algebra , the space of morphism @xmath265 is @xmath264-algebra ( see @xcite proposition 1.1 ) .",
    "it is also a @xmath42-algebra by proposition  [ tensor - white ] .",
    "as explained by g.  barnich , r.  fulp , t.  lada , and j.  stasheff in @xcite , when @xmath60 is a cocommutative coalgebra , @xmath265 is always a @xmath140-algebra .",
    "this comes from the fact that @xmath266 is the unit object for @xmath106 and @xmath267 .",
    "motivated by structures appearing in lagrangian field theories in physics , these authors studied the algebraic structures of @xmath265 when @xmath60 is a coassociative coalgebra and @xmath0 a lie algebra or a poisson algebra . since @xmath265 is a @xmath42-algebra , manin s white product for operads",
    "gives a way to describe such structures .",
    "the white product is a construction that preserves the grading of the properads .    if @xmath268 and @xmath269 , the white product of @xmath140 and @xmath253 is a properad generated by @xmath7 with relations in @xmath270 .    if @xmath232 and @xmath21 are homogenous of weight @xmath43 , that is @xmath271 , then @xmath42 is once again a properad defined by homogenous relations of weight @xmath43 .",
    "it comes from the definition of the morphism @xmath38 which preserves the grading .",
    "@xmath248    * let @xmath0 and @xmath13 be two quadratic associative algebras .",
    "the white product @xmath272 is equal to @xmath273 , which is the definition given by manin in @xcite .",
    "it is isomorphic via @xmath260 to the hadamard ( or segre ) product @xmath274 .",
    "this crucial property allowed j. backelin to prove in his thesis @xcite that the white product of two koszul algebras is a koszul algebra . *",
    "an associative algebra @xmath1 is _ @xmath43-homogenous _ if @xmath275 .",
    "r. berger , m. dubois - violette and m. wambst generalized manin s black and white products to @xmath43-homogenous algebras in @xcite .",
    "berger and marconnet proved that the black product of two n - homogenous koszul algebra is still koszul under some extra assumptions ( distributivity ) in @xcite proposition 2.8 . for",
    "two @xmath43-homogenous algebras , the definition given above coincide with their definition .",
    "note that the definition given here can be applied to non - homogenous algebras .",
    "the class of artin - schelter algebras @xcite provide interesting examples of non - homogenous algebras",
    ". it would be interesting to study the properties of the white product of such algebras , for instance the ones of global dimension @xmath276 of @xcite .",
    "* when @xmath140 and @xmath253 are binary quadratic operads , the modules @xmath22 and @xmath277 are equal to @xmath278 and @xmath279 . in that case , we get @xmath280 and @xmath281 .",
    "this construction is the original one described by ginzburg and kapranov in @xcite .",
    "note that in this case , the white product is not , in general , equal to the hadamard product .",
    "( the morphism @xmath260 is not an isomorphism in general ) .",
    "a direct consequence of this fact is that the white product of two koszul operads is not necessarily a koszul operad again .",
    "see section  [ counterexample ] for a counterexample .",
    "we dualize the arguments and work in the opposite category .",
    "this gives the definition _ black product _ of coproperads .",
    "let @xmath242 be a colax @xmath23-monoidal category such that @xmath243 admits cofree comonoids .",
    "there exists a natural morphism of comonoids @xmath282 .",
    "the black product of two coproperads @xmath215 and @xmath283 is the image of the morphism of comonoids @xmath284 @xmath285_{\\psi } { \\mathcal{f}}^c(v ) { \\otimes}{\\mathcal{f}}^c(w)\\   & \\ar@{>->}[l]_{\\iota { \\otimes}\\iota}{\\ { \\mathcal{c}}(v , { \\overline{r}})\\otimes { \\mathcal{c}}(w,\\overline{s } ) }    \\ar@{->>}[d]^{\\bar{\\psi } }   \\\\ & & \\ar@{>->}[ull ] { \\mathcal{c}}(v , { \\overline{r}})\\bullet { \\mathcal{c}}(w,\\overline{s } ) . } \\ ] ] it is equal to @xmath286 .",
    "black and white constructions are dual to each other under linear duality .",
    "[ blackdualwhite ] let @xmath145 and @xmath287 be two quadratic data , with @xmath3 and @xmath211 locally finite .",
    "we have the following isomorphism of properads @xmath288 .    since @xmath116 is the transpose of @xmath115 , we have @xmath289 , up to isomorphism like @xmath290 .",
    "therefore , we get @xmath291 . by proposition  [ coproperad->properad ]",
    ", we have @xmath292    one of the main interest of the classical notions of black and white products is that one gives the other via the koszul dual functor . in the next sections ,",
    "we define a black product for monoids ( operad and non - symmetric operads ) .",
    "the translation of theorem  [ blackdualwhite ] in this framework will give the relation with koszul dual functor .",
    "in this section , we study manin products for ( symmetric ) operads . we first give a sufficient condition for the white product to be equal to the hadamard product .",
    "then , we recall the bases used to describe binary quadratic operads and their koszul dual operad .",
    "we refer the reader to @xcite , @xcite and @xcite for complete references .",
    "we make our constructions explicit for binary quadratic operads in order to do computations .",
    "the linear dual version of the black product for cooperads defines a product for operads which corresponds to the definition of ginzburg and kapranov , where we make the signs precise .",
    "we give an example of a pair of koszul operads such that their products is not koszul .",
    "this shows that black and white products for operads do not behave like black and white products for associative algebras . following yu .",
    "i. manin , we prove that @xmath39 is always a hopf operad .",
    "finally , we describe the relation between unary operators and black products .",
    "we saw in the previous section that the composite @xmath293 factors through its image @xmath294 .",
    "therefore , @xmath260 is an isomorphism if and only if the composite @xmath293 is an epimorphism",
    ". we shall give a sufficient condition for this .",
    "+ consider the case of binary quadratic operads , that is quadratic operads generated by binary operations ( @xmath295 for @xmath296 ) . in this case , the free operad on @xmath3 is given by ( non - planar ) binary trees with vertices labelled by operations of @xmath3 .",
    "denote by @xmath297 such a tree with @xmath298 vertices and the induced _ label morphism _ by @xmath299 .",
    "let @xmath140 be a binary quadratic operad such that for every @xmath300 and every binary tree @xmath297 with @xmath298 vertices , the composite @xmath301 is surjective .    for every binary quadratic",
    "operad @xmath253 , the white product @xmath42 is equal to the hadamard product @xmath264 .",
    "it is enough to prove that @xmath293 is an epimorphism .",
    "let @xmath302 be an elementary tensor of @xmath303 , where @xmath25 .",
    "the element @xmath304 of @xmath305 can be written @xmath306 , with @xmath307 a finite set of trees and @xmath308 elements of @xmath309 . by the assumption",
    ", there exists @xmath310 in @xmath311 such that @xmath312 , for every @xmath313 .",
    "therefore , we have @xmath314 .",
    "finally , it shows that @xmath315    the condition of this proposition means that every operation of @xmath140 can be written by any type of composition of generating operations . in the next corollary",
    ", we show that the operads @xmath266 , @xmath316 and @xmath317 are examples of such operads .",
    "recall briefly that @xmath266 is the operad for commutative algebras .",
    "the operad @xmath316 was introduced by f. chapoton in @xcite and @xmath317 was defined in @xcite appendix a.    [ hadamard = tensor ] for every binary quadratic operad @xmath253 , we have    * @xmath318 .",
    "the operad @xmath266 is neutral for the white product in the category of binary quadratic operads .",
    "* @xmath319 and @xmath320    the operad @xmath266 is generated by @xmath321 with trivial action of @xmath322 and the associativity relation .",
    "hence , we have only one commutative operation with arity @xmath108 , that is @xmath323 .",
    "therefore , for every tree @xmath297 , the morphism @xmath324 is a surjection on @xmath249 and @xmath325 .",
    "the operad @xmath316 corresponds to commutative operations with one input emphasized ( see @xcite 4.2 and @xcite 1.3.2 ) . in arity @xmath108",
    ", we have @xmath108 operations @xmath326 where @xmath327 corresponds to the corolla with @xmath108 inputs such that the @xmath328th input ( or branch ) is emphasized .",
    "the composition of corollas gives a corolla where the leaf emphasized is the one with a path to the root via emphasized branches .",
    "@xmath329 & 2 \\ar@{=}[d ] & 3 \\ar@{-}[dl ] & & 4 \\ar@{-}[dr ] & 5 \\ar@{=}[d ]   & 6 \\ar@{-}[dl ] \\\\   &   * { } & & & & * { }   & \\\\   & & &   * { }    \\ar@{=}[rru ]   \\ar@{-}[llu ] & & & \\\\   & & & \\ar@{-}[u ] & & & } } \\ \\mapsto \\ e^6_5\\ ] ]",
    "let @xmath297 be a binary tree with @xmath298 vertices . to get @xmath327 ,",
    "it is enough the look at the unique path from the @xmath328th leaf to the root and index the vertices on this path with the relevant operations .",
    "@xmath330 & 3 & 4   \\ar@{-}[dl ] \\\\",
    "\\ar@{-}[dr ] & & e^2_1 \\ar@{=}[dl ] & \\\\ & \\ar@{=}[dr ] e^2_2 & & \\ar@{-}[dl]\\\\ & &   e^2_1 \\ar@{-}[d ] & \\\\ & & & } } \\   \\mapsto \\ e^4_2\\ ] ] the operations of @xmath331 are corollas with at least one leaf emphasized and the proof is the same .",
    "this corollary shows that the hadamard product of one operad @xmath266 , @xmath316 or @xmath317 with any other binary quadratic operad is again a binary quadratic operad . for @xmath266 ,",
    "the result is obvious . in the particular case of @xmath316",
    "this result was proved directly by f. chapoton in @xcite . for every binary quadratic operad @xmath253 ,",
    "he constructed by hand a quadratic operad isomorphic to @xmath332 .",
    "this construction is actually the white product @xmath333 .",
    "[ permwhiteas ] we have @xmath334 .    using the complete description of @xmath316 , @xmath335 and @xmath336 , chapoton proved in @xcite that @xmath337 .",
    "apply the previous corollary to conclude .",
    "the preceding section gives a method for computing the white product for a particular class of operads .",
    "when we can not apply this method , we need the explicit form of the products to compute them . in this section",
    ", we describe a basis for binary quadratic operads and their koszul dual operads .",

    "jean - louis loday defined the operad @xmath465 by two operations such that their sum is an associative product ( see @xcite ) . in the same way",
    ", he defined the operad @xmath466 with one product such that its symmetrized version is a associative ( and commutative ) product .",
    "this process is often called a _ splitting of associativity_. proposition  [ computations ] shows that we can interpret the operation @xmath467 as a natural way of splitting the associativity .",
    "+ a commutative algebra is an associative algebra .",
    "therefore , we have a morphism of operads @xmath468 .",
    "since a commutative algebra is a @xmath316-algebra and a @xmath316-algebra is an associative algebra , the previous morphism factors through @xmath469 .",
    "similarly , a zinbiel algebra is a dendriform algebra @xmath470 .",

    "+ one interesting property of the black and white products is to recover classical operads and morphisms between them by means of products from simpler operads .",
    "we have the dual diagram of operads @xmath507 & \\ar[l ] { \\mathcal{l}ie}\\\\ { \\mathcal{d}ias}\\ar[u ] & { \\mathcal{p}relie}\\circ { \\mathcal{p}erm}\\ar[l ] \\ar[u ] & \\ar[l ] \\ar[u ] { \\mathcal{l}eib}.}\\ ] ]    the operad @xmath435 allows to factor the map @xmath508 .",
    "the notion of @xmath435-algebra is important and has application in deformation theory and differential geometry for instance ( see @xcite ) .",
    "the second row @xmath509 was introduced by j .-",
    "loday with a view toward applications in algebraic k - theory ( see the introduction of @xcite ) .",
    "the operad @xmath336 appears naturally when one tries to build a bicomplex in algebraic k - theory with the same form then the one in cyclic homology ( the additive counterpart of algebraic k - theory ) .",
    "since the operad @xmath510 factors the map @xmath511 , we expect the operad @xmath510 to appear in these fields in the future .",
    "+ recall from @xcite , that a basis for @xmath512 is given by the set of rooted trees with @xmath108 vertices labelled by @xmath513 . from corollary",
    "[ hadamard = tensor ] , we have @xmath514 . therefore , a basis for @xmath515 is provided by the set of rooted trees with @xmath108 vertices labelled by @xmath516 with one vertex emphasized .",
    "we leave to the reader to describe the composition map of this operad .",
    "( use the composition of @xmath435 based on rooted trees given in @xcite with the fact that only the insertion of a tree in an emphasized vertex keeps a vertex emphasized ) .      in this section , we show that the category of koszul operads is not stable by white and black products .",
    "we exhibit a pair of koszul operads whose black product is not koszul .",
    "+ consider the _",
    "operad @xmath517 defined by a generating skew - symmetric binary operation such that every composition of it vanishes .",
    "the operad @xmath518 is equal to the quadratic operad generated by a binary operation @xmath519 with the following relations : @xmath520 and @xmath521 , for every @xmath522 .",
    "we use the same notations @xmath523 for the space @xmath21 of relations of the operad @xmath435 .",
    "the space @xmath232 of relations of the nilpotent operad is generated by @xmath524 , @xmath525 and @xmath526 . by symmetry of the relations",
    ", we only have to compute the three terms @xmath527 they correspond to @xmath528    the operad @xmath518 is not koszul .",
    "because of its relations , the operad @xmath518 has no operations in arity @xmath108 for @xmath108 greater than @xmath276 , that is @xmath529 for @xmath530 .",
    "recall that the poincar series of an operad @xmath140 is defined by @xmath531 ( see @xcite section @xmath339 or @xcite appendix b.5.c . ) . when an operad @xmath140 is koszul , its poincar series and the poincar series of its dual verify the equation @xmath532 ( @xcite formula @xmath533 ) .",
    "the poincar series @xmath534 is @xmath535 .",
    "its inverse for the composition is @xmath536 since the @xmath537 coefficient is negative , this series does not correspond to the poincar series of an operad .",
    "therefore the operad @xmath518 is not koszul .",
    "the operad @xmath435 is koszul ( see @xcite for a proof in characteristic @xmath54 and @xcite for a more general one ) .",
    "any nilpotent operad is koszul ( the koszul dual is a free operad , which is koszul ) .",
    "so the operad @xmath518 is the black product of two koszul operads which is not a koszul operad .",
    "this result comes from the fact the morphism @xmath37 ( and the morphism @xmath38 ) is not an isomorphism in general .",
    "the morphism @xmath37 is a projection and kills part of the relations .",
    "therefore , the coherence between the relations , expressed by the koszul property , does not hold anymore .      in this section",
    ", we generalize the main result of @xcite about the adjunction between the black and the white products to @xmath249-ary quadratic operads .",
    "+ let @xmath249 be an integer greater than @xmath23 . consider the category of _ @xmath249-ary quadratic operads",
    ", that is quadratic operads generated by a finite dimensional @xmath20-module concentrated in arity @xmath249 .",
    "a morphism between two @xmath249-ary quadratic operads @xmath376 and @xmath538 is a morphism induced by a map of @xmath539-modules @xmath540 .",
    "denote this category by _ @xmath249.q - op_.    one can generalize the basis and the non - degenerate bilinear form of [ binaryquadraticoperad ] for the binary case to the @xmath249-ary case . then lemma  [ phipsiorthogonal ] and proposition  [ blackoperad ] also hold in @xmath249.q - op , which defines black products in this category .",
    "recall from v. gnedbaye @xcite the notion of _ @xmath249-lie algebra _ , that is a module endowed with a @xmath249-ary antisymmetric bracket satisfying a generalized jacobi relation .",
    "we denote the associated operad by @xmath541 .",
    "gnedbaye proved that @xmath541 is the koszul dual operad of @xmath542 ( denoted @xmath543 in @xcite ) , where a @xmath542-algebra is module equipped with a @xmath249-ary commutative and totally associative operation .",
    "the black and white products endow the category of @xmath249-ary quadratic operads with a structure of symmetric monoidal category , where the operad @xmath541 is the unit object for @xmath420 and the operad @xmath542 is the unit object for @xmath267 .    the same arguments as in [ hadamard = white ] show that for a @xmath249-ary quadratic operad @xmath140 , we have @xmath544 . if @xmath545 , @xmath546 , otherwise @xmath547 . the rest of the proof is straightforward .",
    "[ adjunction ] there is a natural isomorphism @xmath548 .",
    "hence , the tensor category of @xmath249-ary quadratic operads with the black product @xmath420 is endowed with an internal @xmath549 object denoted @xmath550 .",
    "dually , @xmath551 defines an internal @xmath552 object in @xmath553 .",

    "let @xmath140 be a @xmath249-ary quadratic operad .",
    "the operad @xmath561 is a comonoid in @xmath562 .",
    "the proof comes from general methods of @xmath560 objects .",
    "composing @xmath563 with @xmath564 , we get that @xmath565 is a comonoid for the tensor product , that is a hopf operad ( see [ bimonoids ] ) .    for every @xmath249-ary quadratic operad @xmath140 ,",
    "the operad @xmath566 is a hopf operad .",
    "the first example is @xmath567 .",
    "other examples are @xmath473 , @xmath568 . + in @xcite ,",
    "i. manin proved the equivalent theorem for quadratic algebras .",
    "this allowed him to realize quantum groups as black products of an algebra with its koszul dual algebra . in this spirit , the previous theorem gives a method to get new `` quantum groups '' , that is hopf operads .",
    "+ the tensor product of a lie algebra with a commutative algebra is again a lie algebra ( courant algebras for instance ) .",
    "this result can be widely generalized .",
    "let @xmath140 be a @xmath249-ary quadratic operad .",
    "for any @xmath237-algebra @xmath0 and any @xmath140-algebra @xmath13 , their tensor product @xmath141 is a @xmath541 algebra ( see @xcite appendix b.5.a . for a proof in the binary case and see @xcite theorem @xmath569 for a proof in the ternary case ) . in the language of operads , it means that there exists a morphism of operads @xmath570 . in the particular case of @xmath571 and @xmath572 ,",
    "loday and i. dokas refined this result and proved in @xcite that the previous map factors through @xmath435 .",
    "we now give a conceptual proof of the existence of the map from @xmath541 to @xmath573 and show that is always comes from a composite with the white product .",
    "[ universalliek ] for every @xmath249-ary quadratic operad @xmath140 , there is a canonical morphism of operads @xmath574 , defined by the commutative diagram @xmath575^{l } \\ar[dr]_{i } & & { \\mathcal{p}}^!{\\otimes}{\\mathcal{p}}\\\\ & { \\mathcal{p}}^ ! \\circ { \\mathcal{p}}\\ar[ur]_{\\bar{\\phi}}.   & } \\ ] ]    apply theorem  [ adjunction ] to the triple of operads @xmath541 , @xmath140 and @xmath140 .",
    "we get a natural isomorphism @xmath576 . since @xmath541 is the unit object for @xmath420 , we have @xmath577 .",
    "define @xmath574 to be the image of the identity of @xmath140 under this isomorphism .",
    "in this section , we recall the definition of the intrinsic lie bracket on the chain complex defining the cohomology theories for algebras over a koszul operad .",
    "we use the previous section to define another lie bracket on the same space .",
    "because of the symmetries , this operation vanishes on cohomology . + let @xmath578 and @xmath579 be two augmented dg - operads and let @xmath580 be a morphism of augmented dg - operads .",
    "this morphism makes @xmath253 a module over @xmath140 .",
    "denote by @xmath581 the partial composition of @xmath140 , that is the composition of two non - trivial operations of @xmath140 .",
    "a homogenous morphism @xmath582 is a _ homogenous derivation of @xmath583 _ if @xmath584 this formula , applied to elements @xmath585 of @xmath586 , where @xmath587 and @xmath588 are homogenous elements of @xmath140 , gives @xmath589 a _ derivation _ is a sum of homogenous derivations .",
    "the set of homogenous derivations with respect to @xmath583 of degree @xmath108 is denoted @xmath590 and the set of derivations is denoted @xmath591 or simply @xmath592 when the morphism @xmath583 is obvious .",
    "we recall the definition of the cohomology of @xmath140-algebras , when @xmath140 is a koszul operad .",
    "let @xmath0 be a @xmath140-algebra , that is there is a morphism of operads @xmath593 .",
    "denote by @xmath594 the cobar construction of @xmath172 , where the differential @xmath595 is the unique derivation which extends the partial coproduct of the koszul dual cooperad @xmath172 . since @xmath140 is a koszul operad",
    ", @xmath596 is a quasi - free resolution of @xmath140 .",
    "@xmath597^{\\sim } \\ar[dr]_{\\rho } & { \\mathcal{p}}\\ar[d]^{\\phi } \\\\ & { \\mathrm{end}}(a).}\\ ] ]    let @xmath598 be a resolution of @xmath140 and let @xmath599 be an homogenous derivation of degree @xmath108 in @xmath600 .",
    "one has @xmath601 .",
    "the degree of @xmath602 is @xmath298 .",
    "it remains to show that @xmath602 is a derivation .",
    "since @xmath603 is a dg - operad , we have @xmath604 since @xmath605 is concentrated in non - negative degree and @xmath0 is concentrated in degree @xmath54 , the composite @xmath606 is null .",
    "the deformation theory of the map @xmath593 is studied via the following cochain complex defined by m. markl in @xcite .",
    "the cohomology of a @xmath140-algebra @xmath0 is defined on the space of derivations of @xmath583 ( see also @xcite , @xcite and @xcite ) .",
    "the _ cohomology of a @xmath140-algebra @xmath0 _ is defined by the ( deformation ) chain complex @xmath607 where the differential @xmath608 is the pullback by @xmath595 , that is @xmath609 .",
    "since @xmath596 is a free operad , we have @xmath610 where @xmath611 denotes the set of @xmath20-equivariant maps between the @xmath20-modules @xmath73 and @xmath43 . + as in the paper of m. kontsevich and y. soibelman @xcite , we can consider the augmented chain complex @xmath612 . up to a shift of degree",
    ", the last space corresponds to the hochschild ( co)chain complex for associative algebras , harrison cohomology of commutative algebras and chevalley - eilenberg for lie algebras .",
    "notice that in the literature , this cohomology is called the cohomology of @xmath0 with coefficient in @xmath0 . since this chain complex is defined to control the deformation of the morphism @xmath38 , that is the structure of @xmath140-algebra on @xmath0 , we call it the cohomology @xmath140 with coefficient in @xmath0 or simply the cohomology of @xmath0 , once the operad is chosen . + in these three cases , the chain complex is a dg - lie algebra whose bracket is often called the _ intrinsic bracket _ ( see j. stasheff @xcite ) .",
    "the space @xmath613 of morphisms from a dg - cooperad to a dg - operad is an @xmath20-module with the action by conjugation , that is @xmath614 .",
    "moreover , it is a dg - operad , called the _ convolution operad _ in @xcite section 1 . on the direct sum of the @xmath358-modules of an operad",
    ", one can define a prelie product @xmath615 whose anti - symmetrization gives a lie bracket .",
    "when the operad is the convolution operad @xmath616 , the prelie product is a degree @xmath54 operation given by @xmath617 where @xmath618 is the partial coproduct of the cooperad @xmath172 .",
    "the intrinsic lie bracket is defined by @xmath619:=f \\star g - ( -1)^{|f||g|}g \\star f$ ] .",
    "the space of @xmath20-equivariant morphisms @xmath620 is equal to the space of invariants @xmath621 with respect to the action by conjugation .",
    "it is a subspace of the convolution operad @xmath622 stable under the prelie product @xmath615 .",
    "( see for instance @xcite for a proof of this in the coinvariant context .",
    "since we work over a field @xmath53 of characteristic @xmath54 , the isomorphism between invariants and coinvariants allows us to conclude . )",
    "the induced lie bracket on @xmath623 defines an intrinsic lie bracket on cohomology .",
    "( we refer the reader to @xcite a complete study of the deformation complex ) .",
    "+ when @xmath624 , it is exactly the structure defined by m. gerstenhaber in @xcite and when @xmath625 it is the lie bracket of nijenhuis and richardson , which controls the formal deformations of @xmath140-algebra structure ( see d. balavoine @xcite section @xmath276 ) . + let @xmath0 be a @xmath140-algebra and @xmath60 be a @xmath172-coalgebra , we have by proposition  [ universalliek ] that @xmath265 is naturally endowed with a structure of @xmath626-algebra and @xmath541-algebra ( see also section  [ exemples hom(c , a ) ] )",
    ". applied to @xmath627 , this result gives that the chain complex @xmath628 is a @xmath629-algebra and a @xmath541-algebra . in the binary case ,",
    "it means that @xmath630 is equipped with another lie bracket @xmath631 of degree @xmath632 .",
    "let @xmath63 be a morphism of degree @xmath632 defined as follows @xmath633    it is a a _ twisting cochain _ , that is @xmath63 is solution to the maurer - cartan equation @xmath634 , when @xmath140 and @xmath0 are concentrated in degree @xmath54 ( see section @xmath569 of getzler - jones @xcite ) .",
    "the lie bracket @xmath635 is equal to @xmath636    note that in the binary case , the latter lie bracket @xmath637 is not equal to the intrinsic lie bracket @xmath638 $ ] .",
    "for instance , there is a shift of degree between the two .",
    "[ formula ] for every @xmath599 and @xmath639 in @xmath628 , we have @xmath640 \\quad \\textrm{and } \\quad   \\ { f , g\\}=\\partial f \\star g + ( -1)^{|f|}f \\star \\partial g - \\partial ( f\\star g).\\end{aligned}\\ ] ]    the proof is straightforward and left to the reader .    equipped with the intrinsic lie bracket",
    "@xmath641 $ ] , @xmath628 becomes a dg - lie algebra .",
    "the second formula shows that the lie bracket @xmath642 vanishes on cohomology .",
    "this result and formula can be explained as follows .",
    "the prelie product comes from the partial composition of the operad .",
    "the general composition product of an operad defines symmetric braces .",
    "since the partial composition of the operad generates the global one , the prelie product generates the symmetric braces .",
    "( see also j .-",
    "oudom and d. guin @xcite and @xcite for a proof of this result ) .",
    "therefore , we can not expect to have other products than the intrinsic lie bracket in general .",
    "in particular examples , it would be interesting to see if the structure of @xmath629-algebra induces a non - trivial structure on cohomology .",
    "we will see in [ adjonctionreguliere ] how to refine this study when the operad is not symmetric ( regular ) .",
    "k. ebrahimi - fard and l. guo in @xcite and j .- l .",
    "loday in @xcite defined and used an analog of manin s black product for regular operads that they called the _ black square product_. in this section , we give the conceptual definitions of manin s black and white square products for regular operads .",
    "they are not equal to the black and white `` circle''-products in the category of operads .",
    "actually , they come from the black and white products in the category of non - symmetric operads .",
    "recall that a _",
    "non - symmetric operad _ is an operad without the actions of the symmetric groups . from a non - symmetric operad @xmath643 , we can associate an @xmath20-module by the collection of the free @xmath358-modules on @xmath644 $ ] . the composition product for the operad @xmath140",
    "is defined from the non - symmetric one .",
    "such an operad is called a _",
    "regular operad_. denote @xmath44 this functor from non - symmetric operads to operads . therefore , the category of regular operads is the image of @xmath44 and is equivalent to the category of non - symmetric operads .",
    "denote by @xmath645 the inverse functor : @xmath646_(0.57){\\sigma } & \\ar@_{->}@<-1ex>[l]_(0.42){u } \\",
    "\\textrm{regular operads}. } \\ ] ]    let @xmath19 be a binary quadratic regular operad . in that case , we have that @xmath3 and @xmath21 are regular modules , that is @xmath647 $ ] and @xmath648 $ ] .",
    "the non - symmetric operad @xmath649 is once again binary and quadratic .",
    "it is given by @xmath650 .",
    "a non - symmetric operad is a monoid in the category of non - negative graded modules with a non - symmetric version of @xmath267 ( see appendix  [ alg - op - properad ] ) . under the hadamard product ,",
    "this category forms a @xmath23-monoidal category .",
    "hence , we can apply arguments of section  [ maninproducts ] and consider the morphism @xmath38 and the induced white product for non - symmetric operads . from two binary quadratic regular operads @xmath19 and @xmath25 , we study the associated white product @xmath651 the idea is now to come back to the category of regular operads using the functor @xmath44 .",
    "the _ white square - product _ of two binary quadratic regular operads @xmath140 and @xmath253 is defined by the following formula @xmath652    more explicitly , the white square - product of @xmath140 and @xmath253 is equal to @xmath653)/\\big ( ( \\phi^{-1}(r'{\\otimes}{\\mathcal{f}}(w ' ) + { \\mathcal{f}}(v'){\\otimes}s')){\\otimes}k[{\\mathbb{s}}_3 ]    \\big)$ ] .",
    "note that the definition given above does not correspond to definition @xmath654 of k. ebrahimi - fard and l. guo in @xcite ( see remark below . )",
    "[ tensorvssquare ] let @xmath0 be a @xmath140-algebra and @xmath13 a @xmath253-algebra , their tensor product @xmath141 is an algebra over the white square - product @xmath655 .",
    "the proof is the same than proposition  [ tensor - white ] .",
