    "the operads @xmath710 and @xmath711 discovered by j .-",
    "loday in @xcite factors this projection @xmath712 \\ar@{<->}@/_2pc/[rr ] _ { ! } & \\chi^{\\pm } \\ar@(r , u ) _ { ! } \\ar@{->>}[r ] & { \\mathcal{d}end}{\\ , \\square \\,}{\\mathcal{d}ias}.}\\ ] ] going from the left to the right , there is one more relation each time .",
    "( the dimensions of the spaces of relations is @xmath713 , @xmath714 and @xmath715 respectively ) .",
    "we can apply the same methods as in section  [ symmoncat ] to prove the same kind of adjunction for black and white square products for regular operads .",
    "consider the category of _ @xmath249-ary quadratic regular operads _ denoted by _ @xmath249.q - reg_. one can extend black and white square products in this category . recall from @xcite that a _ totally associative @xmath249-ary algebra _ is a module equipped with a regular @xmath249-ary operation such that all the quadratic compositions are equal .",
    "denote the corresponding operad by @xmath716 .",
    "dually , a _ partially associative @xmath249-ary algebra _ is a module equipped with a regular @xmath249-ary operation such that the sum of all quadratic compositions is zero .",
    "denote the corresponding operad by @xmath717 .",
    "gnedbaye proved that these two operads are koszul dual to each other .",
    "the black and white square products endow the category of @xmath249-ary quadratic regular operads with a structure of symmetric monoidal category , where the operad @xmath717 is the unit object for @xmath45 and the operad @xmath716 is the unit object for @xmath46 .",
    "[ adjunction ] there is a natural isomorphism @xmath718 .",
    "[ operations ] for every @xmath249-ary quadratic regular operad @xmath140 , there is a canonical morphism of operads @xmath719 , defined by the commutative diagram @xmath720^{l } \\ar[dr]_{i } & & { \\mathcal{p}}^!{\\otimes}{\\mathcal{p}}\\\\ & { \\mathcal{p}}^ ! { \\ , \\square \\,}{\\mathcal{p}}\\ar[ur]_{\\bar{\\phi}}.   & } \\ ] ]    this proposition can be seen as a refinement of proposition  [ universalliek ] . when @xmath140 is a @xmath249-ary regular quadratic operad , the map @xmath721 factors through @xmath717 , where the morphism @xmath722 is induced by the anti - symmetrization of the @xmath249-ary partially associative product as in the binary case .      in this section ,",
    "we refine the arguments of section  [ cohomology operations ] for non - symmetric ( regular ) operads .",
    "this gives non - vanishing natural operations on the deformation chain complex of any algebras over such operads .",
    "more precisely , we prove that , under some assumptions , the ( co)chain complex defining the cohomology of algebras is a multiplicative operad .",
    "+ recall from @xcite that an _ operad with multiplication _ is a non - symmetric operad @xmath140 endowed with a morphism @xmath723 .",
    "let @xmath140 be a finitely generated binary non - symmetric koszul operad .",
    "following section  [ cohomology operations ] , the chain complex defining the cohomology of a @xmath140-algebra @xmath0 is equal to @xmath724 which is a non - symmetric ( convolution ) operad . by proposition  [ operations",
    "] , there is a morphism of operads @xmath725 . since @xmath726",
    ", we have @xmath727 these results form the following proposition .    [ multiplicative operad ] for every finitely",
    "generated binary non - symmetric koszul operad @xmath140 and every @xmath140-algebra @xmath0 , the chain complex defining its cohomology @xmath628 is an operad with multiplication .",
    "the multiplication @xmath723 of an operad @xmath140 allows us to define a canonical cosimplicial structure on it ( see @xcite section @xmath339 ) and then a differential map @xmath163 by alternate summation ( see @xcite formula @xmath449 ) .",
    "denote by @xmath212 the image of the associative operation .",
    "the face maps @xmath728 are defined by @xmath729    the differential @xmath163 is equal to @xmath730 $ ] .    with the same assumptions ,",
    "the differential @xmath731 on @xmath628 is equal to @xmath732 .",
    "hence , the chain complex @xmath628 is always cosimplicial .",
    "the image of the associative operation in @xmath613 is the map @xmath733 defined in section  [ cohomology operations ] .",
    "we prove in lemma  [ formula ] that the differential on @xmath628 is equal to @xmath734=(-1)^{|f|}d(f)$ ] .",
    "therefore , the chain complex @xmath735 is endowed with two types of operations : _ braces _ operations induced by the non - symmetric operadic structure and an associative operation called the _ cup product _ coming from the properties of manin s products . in @xcite , m. gerstenhaber and a.a .",
    "voronov defined the notion of _ homotopy @xmath736-algebra _ which gives the compatibility between these types of operations .",
    "their purpose was to describe the operations acting of the chain complex of hochschild cohomology of an associative algebra .",
    "actually , the structure of homotopy @xmath736-algebra on the deformation chain complex and the structure of gerstenhaber algebra on cohomology is universal among finitely generated binary non - symmetric koszul operads .    for every finitely generated binary non - symmetric koszul operad @xmath140 and every @xmath140-algebra @xmath0 , the chain complex @xmath735 is a homotopy @xmath736-algebra and the cohomology space @xmath737 is a gerstenhaber algebra .",
    "apply theorem @xmath339 of @xcite which asserts that any multiplicative operad induces a homotopy @xmath736-algebra on the direct sum of its components . to prove the second part ,",
    "apply the computations of the proof of corollary @xmath158 of @xcite .",
    "finally , we extend and prove deligne s conjecture to any algebra over a finitely generated binary non - symmetric koszul operad , which includes the original case of associative algebras .",
    "+ the little disk operad @xmath738 is a topological operad defined by configurations of disks on the plane . in 1976 , f. cohen showed that the homology operad @xmath739 is equal to the operad coding gerstenhaber algebras @xcite .",
    "this led p. deligne to make the following wish `` i would like the complex computing hochschild cohomology to be an algebra over [ the singular chain operad of the little disks ] or a suitable version of it '' in @xcite . by suitable version of it , he meant another operad homotopically equivalent to @xmath738 .",
    "this conjecture can be seen as a lifting on the level of chain complexes of the result of f. cohen . in 1999 ,",
    "j.e . mcclure and j.h .",
    "smith gave a prove of this conjecture in the following way .",
    "first , they construct a topological operad @xmath740 whose chain version acts on any multiplicative operad .",
    "then , they show that this operad is equivalent to the little disks operad .",
    "this proof with proposition  [ multiplicative operad ] shows that deligne conjecture can be generalized to any finitely generated binary non - symmetric koszul operads and is not specific to the case of associative algebras .",
    "[ deligneconjecture ] for every finitely generated binary non - symmetric koszul operad @xmath140 and every @xmath140-algebra @xmath0 , the chain complex @xmath628 is an algebra over an operad equivalent to the singular chains of the little disks operad .    since @xmath628 is an operad with multiplication , the operad @xmath740 of @xcite acts on it . and this operad is weakly equivalent to the little disks operad by theorem @xmath741 of @xcite .",
    "notice that the non - symmetric case is very different from the symmetric one .",
    "the lie bracket @xmath742 described in section  [ cohomology operations ] vanishes on cohomology .",
    "when the algebra is modelled by a non - symmetric operad , this lie bracket is the symmetrization of an associative operation , the cup - product , which is not necessarily trivial on cohomology .",
    "+ in @xcite , m. markl defined the notion of _ natural operations _ on cohomology and asked a few questions and conjectures about the operad @xmath743 generated by these operations . here",
    "we have proved that , for binary non - symmetric koszul operads , the gerstenhaber operad imbeds into @xmath743 . for more precise statements depending on the operad @xmath140 , one has to work with @xmath626 . in the symmetric case , operations of @xmath626 could give non - trivial operations in cohomology .    in @xcite ,",
    "d. yau proved this generalized deligne s conjecture for a few operads found by j .-",
    "his method is based on a notion of _ pre - operadic system _ which ensures that @xmath724 is an operad .",
    "actually this notion comes from the axioms of a basis for the koszul dual cooperad .",
    "the cohomology space of an algebra over any non - symmetric koszul operad is always a non - symmetric operad ( convolution operad from the koszul dual cooperad to the endomorphism operad ) .",
    "then , the author shows , case by case , that the cohomology of the operad is multiplicative .",
    "in fact , the adjunction of manin s products for non - symmetric binary operads always provides a morphism @xmath744 .      in this section , we study the example of black square - product @xmath47 introduced by m. aguiar and j .- l .",
    "loday in @xcite .",
    "we prove that the koszul dual of @xmath745 is the operad @xmath746 .",
    "+ the operad @xmath465 is a split of one associative product @xmath615 into two products @xmath474 and @xmath475 , @xmath747 .",
    "the operad @xmath745 was defined by m. aguiar and j .- l .",
    "loday in @xcite as a split of an associative product @xmath615 into four products @xmath748 , @xmath749 , @xmath750 and @xmath751 , that is @xmath752 .",
    "it was proved in @xcite that this operad @xmath745 is equal to the black square - product @xmath753 .",
    "therefore one can interpret the splitting of associativity with the black square - product with @xmath465 . at the end of their paper ,",
    "m. aguiar and j .- l .",
    "loday raised one question `` what is the koszul dual of the operad @xmath745 ? '' and two conjectures .",
    "the first conjecture deals with the dimensions of the @xmath358-modules @xmath754 and the second one is that the operad @xmath745 is koszul . in the rest of this section , we answer these questions . +",
    "the previous section give a direct answer to the first question .",
    "the koszul dual of @xmath745 is equal to @xmath755 .",
    "since the koszul dual of @xmath465 is the operad @xmath756 ( @xcite proposition @xmath757 ) , we have @xmath758 from proposition  [ blacksquareoperad ] .",
    "it remains to use the explicit form of the white square - product to describe @xmath703 .",
    "[ dualquad ] the operad @xmath755 is isomorphic to @xmath759 .",
    "denote the basis of @xmath760 by @xmath761 and its dual basis , the basis of @xmath762 , by @xmath763 .",
    "the induced basis of @xmath764 is @xmath765 and the induced basis of @xmath766 is @xmath767 .",
    "the relations of @xmath336 are easy to remember .",
    "represent the operation @xmath768 by the tree @xmath769 &   & \\ar@{-}[dl ]   \\\\   & \\ar@{-}[d ] &   \\\\   & & } } $ ] and the operation @xmath770 by the tree @xmath771 &   & \\ar@2{-}[dl ]   \\\\   & \\ar@{-}[d ] &   \\\\   & & } } $ ] .",
    "any element of @xmath772 can be seen as a tree with exactly one path from one leaf to the root .",
    "for example , the composition @xmath773 corresponds to the tree @xmath774 & & \\ar@2{-}[dl ] & &    \\\\ & \\ar@2{-}[dr ]   &    & \\ar@{-}[dl ] & \\\\ & & \\ar@{-}[d ] & & \\\\ & & } } $ ] . to get the relations of @xmath336 , identify the trees with paths from the same leaf .",
    "for instance , we have @xmath775 , which corresponds to @xmath776 & & \\ar@2{-}[dl ] & &    \\\\ & \\ar@2{-}[dr ]   &    & \\ar@{-}[dl ] & \\\\ & & \\ar@{-}[d ] & & \\\\ & & } } = \\vcenter{\\xymatrix@m=0pt@r=6pt@c=6pt { & & \\ar@2{-}[dr ] & & \\ar@{-}[dl ]   \\\\ & \\ar@{-}[dr ] & & \\ar@2{-}[dl ]   & \\\\ & & \\ar@{-}[d ] & & \\\\ & & } } $ ] . the relations of @xmath336 are @xmath777 where the first line corresponds to the left leaf , the second one to the middle leaf and the last one to the right leaf",
    ". for simplicity , denote these compositions and relations by @xmath778 the operad @xmath336 is equal to @xmath779)/(r'{\\otimes}k[{\\mathbb{s}}_3])$ ] .",
    "one can see that the following relations are elements of @xmath780 @xmath781 the other ones are obtained by the symmetries @xmath776 & & \\ar@{-}[dl ] & &    \\\\ & \\ar@{-}[dr ]   &    & \\ar@{-}[dl ] & \\\\ & & \\ar@{-}[d ] & & \\\\ & & } } \\leftrightarrow \\vcenter{\\xymatrix@m=0pt@r=6pt@c=6pt { & & \\ar@{-}[dr ] & & \\ar@{-}[dl ]   \\\\ & \\ar@{-}[dr ] & & \\ar@{-}[dl ]   & \\\\ & & \\ar@{-}[d ] & & \\\\ & & } } $ ] and @xmath782 .",
    "we get @xmath783 linearly independent elements in @xmath784 . since the dimension of @xmath785 is @xmath786 , we know that these elements form a basis of @xmath780 . hence , they give the relations defining @xmath787 .",
    "interpret these relations in the same way as the ones of @xmath336 .",
    "an element of @xmath788 can be seen as a tree with two kind of paths , one given by the left side of @xmath106 and the second one by the right side of @xmath106 .",
    "for instance , the tree @xmath789 & & \\ar@2{-}[dl ] & &    \\\\ & \\ar@2{-}[dr ]   &    & \\ar@{.}[dl ] & \\\\ & & \\ar@{-}[d ] & & \\\\ & & } } $ ] represents @xmath790 , where the left side corresponds to @xmath791 and the right side to @xmath792 .",
    "this produces two indexes for the leaves . with this identification",
    ", the relations of @xmath787 mean that any elements written with trees such that the same leaves are indexed by the same `` colors '' are equal .",
    "therefore , a basis for @xmath793 is given by planar corollas with @xmath108 leaves indexed by two colors .",
    "the composition of such trees is a corollas and to know which leaf is indexed by which color , follow the path of the same color . as a consequence",
    ", we have @xmath794 .",
    "( a basis for the operad @xmath336 is given by corollas with one leaf emphasized . tensoring with @xmath316 induces another independent index of the leaves . and",
    "the compositions are the same . )    more generally , we get the duals of the operad coding octo - algebras of p. leroux @xcite and its follow - up . since @xmath795 , we get @xmath796 and , for any @xmath797 , @xmath798 .",

    ", we get another form for @xmath745 .",
    "we have @xmath804      aguiar and loday made in @xcite the conjecture that the operad @xmath745 is koszul .",
    "we show this statement using poset s method of @xcite . more generally , we prove that the operads of the form @xmath49 and @xmath50 are koszul .",
    "p. leroux introduced in @xcite the operad @xmath805 .",
    "we prove the same results for the family @xmath51 and @xmath52 .",
    "all these families provide infinitely many examples of the generalized deligne s conjecture proved in theorem  [ deligneconjecture ] . + in order to study the homological properties of the algebras over an operad , it is crucial to prove that the operad is koszul .",
    "we refer the reader to the paper of b. fresse @xcite or to the book of m. markl , s. shnider and j. stasheff @xcite for a full treatment of the subject . since an operad is koszul if and only if its koszul dual is koszul , we work with the simplest one to prove that the pair is a pair of koszul operads . in the case of the operads @xmath745 and @xmath806",
    ", we will prove that the koszul property holds for the last one , @xmath807 .",
    "+ let @xmath140 be an algebraic operad coming from an operad in the category of sets .",
    "for instance , it is the case when the relations defining the operads only involve equalities between two terms and no linear combination .",
    "the operads @xmath335 , @xmath266 , @xmath316 and @xmath336 are of this type . in @xcite , we defined a family of partition type posets associated to such an operad @xmath140 and proved that the operad is koszul over @xmath48 and over any field @xmath249 if and only each maximal intervals of the posets are cohen - macaulay .",
    "+ we saw in the proof of theorem  [ dualquad ] that @xmath808 . therefore , @xmath787 is a set operad with basis @xmath809 .",
    "the partitions associated to @xmath787 are of the form @xmath810 , where @xmath811 and @xmath812 .",
    "the order between the @xmath787-partitions is given by the refinement of partitions with respect to the two indexes .",
    "for instance , we have @xmath813 .    for each @xmath797 , the maximal intervals of the poset @xmath814 associated to the operad @xmath807 are totally semi - modular .",
    "the proof is the same than lemma @xmath815 , @xmath816 and @xmath817 of @xcite .",
    "the operad @xmath745 is koszul over @xmath48 .",
    "the maximal intervals of the posets @xmath814 are totally semi - modular .",
    "therefore they are cohen - macaulay over @xmath48 by @xcite .",
    "one can see that the operad @xmath807 is a basic set operad ( see @xcite page 6 )",
    ". then we can apply theorem @xmath818 of @xcite .",
    "the dimensions of the homogenous components of @xmath745 are equal to @xmath819    when an operad @xmath140 is koszul , there are relations between the dimensions of @xmath820 and the dimensions of @xmath821 ( see @xcite theorem @xmath533 or @xcite appendix b.5.c . ) .",
    "use these relations with corollary  [ dimquad ! ] to conclude .",
    "more generally , we have seen that , for every @xmath797 , @xmath822 , which is a basic set operad .",
    "the related partitions have the same form than the ones for @xmath787 but with @xmath108 types of indices instead of @xmath23 .",
    "[ dendn - koszul ] for every @xmath108 , the operad @xmath49 is koszul over @xmath48 .",
    "apply the same arguments .",
    "loday and m. ronco introduced in @xcite the pair of koszul dual operads @xmath823 and @xmath824 . a @xmath823-algebra is a @xmath336-algebra with an extra operation . in @xcite , we defined a commutative analogue of @xmath823 which we denoted by @xmath317 .",
    "the @xmath317-partitions are partitions with at least one element of each block emphasized .",
    "the @xmath823-partitions are ordered partitions with at least one element in the block emphasized . using the same ideas than before , we have to following results .",
    "the operad @xmath825 .",
    "the maximal intervals of @xmath826 are totally semi - modular .    for every @xmath108 ,",
    "the operads @xmath52 and @xmath51 are koszul over @xmath48 .",
    "recall from @xcite proposition @xmath827 that @xmath828 is isomorphic to the @xmath829 operad defined by p. leroux in @xcite .",
    "the previous theorem gives that the @xmath829 operad is koszul over @xmath48 .",
    "+ from this result , we get four infinite families of operads for which deligne s conjecture holds .",
    "let @xmath140 be an operad of the form @xmath49 , @xmath50 , @xmath51 or @xmath52 .",
    "then for any @xmath140-algebra @xmath0 , the chain complex @xmath628 is an algebra over an operad equivalent to the singular chains of the little disks operad .    by the previous theorems , these operads",
    "are finitely generated binary non - symmetric and koszul . then apply theorem  [ deligneconjecture ] .",
    "notice that the poset s method of @xcite allowed us to prove that these operads are koszul over @xmath48 . since the proof of deligne s conjecture @xcite also works over the ring of integers , this last corollary holds over @xmath48 .",
    "this appendix is a short survey on the notions of associative algebras , operads and properads which are the main examples of @xmath23-monoidal categories treated in this text . for a complete treatment of the subject , we refer the reader to @xcite .",
    "associative algebras , operads and properads are monoids in some monoidal categories",
    ". + let @xmath249 be the ground field and let @xmath830 be the monoidal category of @xmath53-modules equipped with the tensor product over @xmath53 .",
    "a monoid @xmath831 in @xmath832 is an _",
    "associative algebra_. the product @xmath833 is associative and @xmath834 is the unit of @xmath0 .",
    "the product of elements @xmath835 of @xmath0 can be represented by an indexed branch , see figure  [ fig1 ]    @xmath836 \\\\ * + [ f-,]{a_1 } \\ar[d ] \\\\ \\vdots \\ar[d]\\\\ * + [ f-,]{a_l } \\ar[d ] \\\\ { } } \\ ] ]    let @xmath73 be a @xmath53-module",
    ". denote by @xmath837 the space of endomorphisms of @xmath73 . with the composition of endomorphisms",
    ", @xmath838 is an associative algebra .",
    "an _ associative coalgebra _ is a comonoid in @xmath832 , that is a monoid in the opposite category .",
    "an _ @xmath20-module _ is a collection @xmath839 of right modules over the symmetric group @xmath358 . in the category of @xmath20-modules",
    ", one defines a monoidal product by the following formula    @xmath840   \\right)_{{\\mathbb{s}}_l},\\ ] ]    where the coinvariants are taken with respect to the action of the symmetric group @xmath841 given by @xmath842 for @xmath843 , @xmath844 , @xmath812 and @xmath845 , such that @xmath846 is the induced block permutation .",
    "+ the notion of @xmath20-module is used to model the multi - linear operations acting on some algebras .",
    "the monoidal product @xmath267 reflects the compositions of operations and can be represented by 2-levelled trees whose vertices are indexed by the elements of @xmath140 and @xmath253 , see figure  [ fig2 ] .",
    "@xmath847 & x_2 \\ar[d ] & x_3 \\ar[dl ] & x_4\\ar[dr ] & & x_5\\ar[dl ] & x_6\\ar[dr ] & x_7\\ar[d ] & x _    8\\ar[dl ] \\\\",
    "\\ar@{--}[r ] & * + [ f-,]{q_1}\\ar@{--}[rrr ] \\ar[drrr ] & & & * + [ f-,]{q_2}\\ar@{--}[rrr ] \\ar[d ]   & & & * + [ f-,]{q_3 } \\ar@{--}[r ] \\ar[dlll ] & \\\\ \\ar@{--}[rrrr ] & & & & * + [ f-,]{p_1 } \\ar[d]\\ar@{--}[rrrr ] & & & & \\\\   & & & & & & & &   } \\ ] ]    the unit of this monoidal category is given by the @xmath20-module @xmath848 , which corresponds to the identity operation represented by @xmath849 .",
    "a monoid @xmath850 in @xmath851 is called an _",
    "operad_. the associative product @xmath852 is called the _ composition product _ and @xmath853 is the _",
    "unit_.    let @xmath73 be a @xmath53-module and consider @xmath854 .",
    "the permutation of the inputs of a morphism in @xmath855 makes @xmath838 into an @xmath20-module . with the natural composition of morphisms",
    ", @xmath838 is an operad called the _",
    "endomorphism operad_.    a _ cooperad _ is a comonoid in @xmath856 .",
    "+ to every @xmath53-module @xmath3 , one can associate an @xmath20-module @xmath857 concentrated in arity @xmath858 .",
    "this defines an embedding of @xmath53-mod into @xmath20-mod .",
    "one can check that this embedding is compatible with the monoidal products , that is @xmath859 .",
    "therefore , @xmath832 is a full monoidal subcategory of @xmath860 .",
    "thus every associative algebra is an operad .",
    "+ we can forget the action of the symmetric groups and work in the category of @xmath861-graded vector spaces .",
    "this category is endowed with a monoidal product , a non - symmetric analog of the previous one .",
    "we still denote it by @xmath267 : @xmath862    a monoid in this monoidal category is called a _",
    "non - symmetric operad_.    we can also define a notion of operads with colors indexing the inputs and the outputs .",
    "the composition of such operations have to fit with the colors .",
    "such operads are called _ colored operads _ ( cf .",
    "+      we are going to pursue this generalization .",
    "elements of an associative algebra can be seen as operations with one input and one output ( see figure  [ fig1 ] ) .",
    "elements of an operad represent operations with multiple inputs but one output . to model operations with multiple inputs and multiple outputs ,",
    "one uses the notion of _ @xmath20-bimodule_. an _",
    "@xmath20-bimodule _ is a collection @xmath863 of modules over the symmetric groups @xmath358 on the right and @xmath864 on the left . in this category , we define a monoidal product based on the composition of operations indexing the vertices of a 2-levelled directed connected graph , see figure  [ fig3 ] . +    @xmath865 & x_2 \\ar[d ] & x _",
    "3\\ar[dl ] & x_4 \\ar[dr ] & & x_5 \\ar[dl ] \\\\",
    "\\ar@{--}[r ] & * + [ f-,]{q_1 } \\ar@{-}[dl ] \\ar@{-}[drr ] \\ar@{--}[rrr ] & & & * + [ f-,]{q_2 } \\ar@{-}[dr ]   \\ar@{-}[dll]|(0.75 ) \\hole   \\ar@{--}[r ] & \\\\   * = 0 { } \\ar[dr ] & & * = 0{}\\ar[dl ] & * = 0{}\\ar[dr ] & & * = 0 { } \\ar[dl]\\\\   \\ar@{--}[r ] & * + [ f-,]{p_1 } \\ar[d ] \\ar@{--}[rrr ] & & & * + [ f-,]{p_2 } \\ar[dl ] \\ar[d ] \\ar[dr ] \\ar@{--}[r ] & \\\\   & y_1 & & y_2   & y_3 & y_4 } \\ ] ]    let @xmath866 and @xmath867 be the number of vertices on the first and on the second level respectively .",
    "let @xmath43 be the number of edges between the first and the second level . to an @xmath866-tuple of integers @xmath868 , we associate @xmath869 . given two @xmath866-tuples @xmath870 and @xmath871 , we denote by @xmath872 the tensor product @xmath873 and we denote by @xmath874 the image of the direct product of the groups @xmath875 in @xmath876 .",
    "let @xmath43 be an integer .",
    "let @xmath877 be a @xmath867-tuple and @xmath878 be a @xmath866-tuple such that @xmath879 .",
    "a _ @xmath880-connected permutation _",
    "@xmath881 is a permutation of @xmath882 such that the graph of a geometric representation of @xmath881 is connected if one gathers the inputs labelled by @xmath883 , for @xmath884 , and the outputs labelled by @xmath885 , for @xmath886 .",
    "the set of @xmath880-connected permutations is denoted by @xmath887 .",
    "consider the permutation @xmath888 in @xmath889 and take @xmath890 and @xmath891 .",
    "if one links the inputs @xmath858 , @xmath23 and @xmath339 , @xmath276 and the outputs @xmath858 , @xmath23 and @xmath339 , @xmath276 , it gives the following connected graph @xmath892[f-]{1 }   \\ar@{-}[r ] \\ar@{-}[d ] & * + [ o][f-]{2 } \\ar@{-}[dr ] & * + [ o][f-]{3 }   \\ar@{-}[dl ] |\\hole \\ar@{-}[r ] & * + [ o][f-]{4 }   \\ar@{-}[d ] \\\\",
    "* + [ o][f-]{1 }   \\ar@{-}[r ] & * + [ o][f-]{2 }   & * + [ o][f-]{3 }   \\ar@{-}[r ] & * + [ o][f-]{4}}\\ ] ] therefore , the permutation @xmath888 is @xmath893-connected .",
    "let @xmath140 and @xmath253 be two @xmath20-bimodules , their monoidal product is given by the formula @xmath894",
    "\\otimes_{\\mathbb{s}_{{\\bar{l } } } } \\mathcal{p}({{\\bar{l}}},\\ , { { \\bar{k}}})\\otimes_{\\mathbb{s}_{{{\\bar{k } } } } } k[{\\mathbb{s}^c}_{{\\bar{k},\\ , \\bar{\\jmath } } } ] \\otimes_{\\mathbb{s}_{{\\bar{\\jmath } } } } \\mathcal{q}({{\\bar{\\jmath}}},\\ , { { \\bar{\\imath } } } ) \\otimes_{\\mathbb{s}_{{\\bar{\\imath } } } } k[\\mathbb{s}_n ] \\right)_{{\\mathbb{s}}_b^{\\textrm{op}}\\times { \\mathbb{s}}_a } , \\ ] ] where the second direct sum runs over the @xmath867-tuples @xmath895 , @xmath896 and the @xmath866-tuples @xmath871 , @xmath870 such that @xmath897 , @xmath898 , @xmath899 and where the coinvariants correspond to the following action of @xmath900 : @xmath901 for @xmath902 , @xmath903 , @xmath904 and for @xmath905 with @xmath906 the corresponding block permutation , @xmath907 and @xmath908 the corresponding block permutation .",
    "the unit @xmath909 for this monoidal product is given by @xmath910    we denote by @xmath911 this monoidal category .",
    "we need to restrict compositions to connected graphs and connected permutations in order to get a monoidal category ( see proposition 1.6 of @xcite ) .",
    "a _ properad _ is a monoid in the monoidal category @xmath912 .    let @xmath73 be a @xmath53-module and consider @xmath913 .",
    "the permutation of the inputs and the outputs of an element of @xmath914 makes @xmath838 into an @xmath20-bimodule .",
    "once again , @xmath838 , endowed with the natural ( connected ) composition of morphisms , is a properad .    a comonoid in @xmath912",
    "is called a _",
    "coproperad_. + to an @xmath20-module @xmath3 , we associate an @xmath20-bimodule @xmath915 defined by @xmath916 this defines an embedding of monoidal categories , that is @xmath917 .",
    "the category @xmath122 is a full monoidal subcategory of @xmath911 .",
    "hence , an operad is a properad .",
    "since the notion of properad includes the one of associative algebras and operads , we work in this general framework throughout the text .",
    "we resume these notions in the following table    @xmath918 & { ( { \\mathbb{s}}\\textrm{-mod } , \\circ ) \\ \\ } \\ar@{>->}[r ] & { ( { \\mathbb{s}}\\textrm{-bimod } , { \\boxtimes})\\   } \\\\ \\textsc{monoid :} &   { \\textrm{associative algebra } \\ \\ } \\ar@{>->}[r ] & { \\textrm{operad } \\ \\   }   \\ar@{>->}[r ] & { \\textrm{properad}. } } \\ ] ]    remark that the first monoidal product @xmath919 is bilinear and symmetric , the second one @xmath267 is only linear on the left and no symmetry .",
    "the third one @xmath57 has no linear nor symmetric properties in general .      in this section ,",
    "we precise the previous analogy with multi - linear operations and recall the notion of an ( al)gebra over a properad .",
    "+ let @xmath920 be an associative algebra and let @xmath73 be a @xmath53-module . recall that a structure of _ module _ over @xmath0 on @xmath73 is given by a morphism of associative algebras @xmath921 .",
    "more generally , we have the following definition .",
    "let @xmath140 be a properad and let @xmath73 be a @xmath53-module .",
    "a structure of _",
    "_ on @xmath73 is a morphism of properads @xmath922 .",
    "when @xmath140 is an operad , this corresponds to the notion of algebra over @xmath140 or _",
    "@xmath140-algebra _ ( see v. ginzburg and m. kapranov @xcite ) . there is an operad @xmath335 such that the category of @xmath335-algebras is equal to the category of non - unital associative algebras , an operad @xmath266 such that the category of @xmath266-algebras is equal to the category of non - unital commutative associative algebras and an operad @xmath388 such that the category of @xmath388-algebras is equal to the category of lie algebras .",
    "+ categories of `` algebras '' defined by products and coproducts ( multiple outputs ) , can not be modelled by operads , one has to use properads .",
    "recall from @xcite , that there is a properad @xmath923 such that the category of @xmath923-gebras is equal to the category of non - unital non - counital bialgebras and there exists a properad @xmath924 such that category of @xmath924-gebras is equal to the category of lie bialgebras , for instance .    following the article of j-.p .",
    "serre @xcite , we choose to call a _",
    "any algebraic structure like modules over an associative algebra , associative algebras , lie algebras , commutative algebras or bialgebras , lie bialgebras , etc ...    this point of view on algebraic structures allows us to understand and describe general properties between different types of gebras .",
    "constructions on the levels of operads or properads induce general relations between the related types of gebras .",
    "the forgetful functor @xmath645 from the category of properads to the category of @xmath20-bimodules has a left adjoint @xmath925 .",
    "@xmath926 & \\ar@_{->}@<-1ex>[l ] { \\ { \\mathbb{s}}\\textrm{-bimod } \\ ,   : \\ , { \\mathcal{f}}.}}\\ ] ]    we gave an explicit construction of it in @xcite by means of a particular colimit .",
    "for every @xmath20-bimodule @xmath3 , it provides the free properad @xmath24 on @xmath3 .",
    "it is given by the direct sum of connected directed graphs with the vertices indexed by elements of @xmath3 .",
    "the composition product @xmath666 is simply defined by the grafting of graphs .",
    "therefore , the number of vertices is preserved by @xmath666 and it induces a natural graduation denoted @xmath927 and called the _",
    "weight_. + remark that , when @xmath3 is a @xmath53-module , we find the tensor algebra @xmath2 on @xmath3 , which is the free associative algebra on @xmath3 .",
    "when @xmath3 is an @xmath20-module , we get the free operad in terms of indexed trees like in @xcite section 2.1 .",
    "+ we can generalize the notion of ideal for an associative algebra to ideals for operads and properads ( see appendix  [ categorical algebra ] ) .",
    "let @xmath3 be an @xmath20-bimodule and @xmath21 be a sub-@xmath20-bimodule of @xmath24 , we consider the ideal generated by @xmath21 in @xmath24 and we denote it by @xmath4 .",
    "as usual , the quotient @xmath376 has a natural structure of properads . when @xmath146 , the quotient properad is called a _",
    "quadratic properad_. when @xmath3 is a @xmath53-module , this definition corresponds to the notion of _ quadratic algebra _ ( see y. manin @xcite ) and when @xmath3 is an @xmath20-module it corresponds to the notion of _ quadratic operad _ of @xcite . +    the symmetric and the exterior algebras are natural examples of quadratic algebras .",
    "the operads @xmath335 , @xmath266 and @xmath388 are the most common quadratic operads ( see @xcite ) .",
    "the properads @xmath924 of lie bialgebras , @xmath928 of infinitesimal bialgebras and @xmath929 of frobenius bialgebras are quadratic properads ( see @xcite section 2.9 ) .    since @xmath21 is homogenous of weight @xmath23 , the quotient properad @xmath376 is graded by the weight .",
    "+ dually , there is a _ connected cofree coproperad _ denoted @xmath143 ( see @xcite section 2.8 ) .",
    "we define another monoidal product in the category of @xmath20-bimodules .",
    "let @xmath3 and @xmath211 be two @xmath20-bimodules .",
    "their hadamard product is defined by @xmath930 .",
    "when @xmath3 and @xmath211 are @xmath20-modules , the hadamard product is equal to @xmath931 . when it is obvious that in the context we are dealing with the hadamard product , we simply denote it by @xmath106 .",
    "+ this monoidal product is bilinear and symmetric . the unit of the hadamard product is the @xmath20-bimodule @xmath932 defined by @xmath933 , with trivial action of @xmath358 and @xmath864 , for all @xmath934 ( and @xmath935 for @xmath20-modules ) .",
    "( the properad @xmath932 models commutative and cocommutative frobenius algebras ) .",
    "the aim of this section is to define the notion of `` ideal of a monoid '' in a modern , categorical point of view . working in the opposite category",
    ", we get the dual notion for comonoids .",
    "the other purpose of this categorical treatment is to characterize the ideal `` generated by '' and its dual notion .      in this section",
    "we define the notions of _ ideal monomorphism _ and _ ideal subobject _ of monoids .",
    "dually , we define the notions of _ coideal epimorphism _ and _ coideal quotient_. + let us work in an abelian monoidal category , that is an abelian category @xmath56 endowed with a monoidal product @xmath57 . consider the subcategory @xmath936 whose objects ar monoids in @xmath56 .",
    "one natural question now is to ask whether @xmath936 is still an abelian category .",
    "the answer is no because the class of monomorphisms is too wide , for instance .",
    "recall that in an abelian category the class of monomorphisms is equal to the class of kernels .",
    "every morphism @xmath937 in @xmath936 admits a kernel @xmath938 is @xmath56 .",
    "the following diagram is commutative @xmath939^{i{\\boxtimes}i } \\ar@{ .. >}[d]^{\\mu_k }   & a{\\boxtimes}a \\ar[r]^{f{\\boxtimes}f } \\ar[d]^{\\mu_a }   & b { \\boxtimes}b   \\ar[d]^{\\mu_b}\\\\ k   \\ar@{>->}[r]^{i } & a   \\ar[r]^{f } & b , } \\ ] ] where @xmath940 and @xmath941 stand for the product of the monoid @xmath0 and @xmath13 respectively . since @xmath942 , the composite @xmath943 is equal to @xmath54 . by the universal property of the kernel @xmath328",
    ", there exists an associative map",
    "@xmath944 making @xmath932 into a monoid and @xmath945 a morphism in @xmath936 .",
    "hence kernels exist in @xmath936 and every kernel is a monomorphism . actually , @xmath932 has more properties than just being a submonoid of @xmath0 ( see [ ideal - classical ] ) , which explains why not all monomorphisms are kernels .",
    "on the other hand , let @xmath946 be a monomorphism of monoids , its cokernel @xmath947 in @xmath56 is not necessarily a monoid .",
    "following kummer s language , we restrict our attention to _ ideal monomorphisms _ , that is monomorphisms that are kernels in @xmath936 .        in this case , we say that @xmath952 is an _ ideal _ ( subobject ) of @xmath0 and @xmath953 is naturally a _ quotient _ monoid , also denoted by @xmath947 .",
    "+ dually , recall that a comonoid in @xmath56 is a monoid in the opposite category @xmath954 . if we dualize the previous arguments in the opposite category , we can see that the category @xmath955 of comonoids in @xmath56 is not an abelian category because the class of epimorphisms is too big .",
    "the cokernel in @xmath56 of a morphism in @xmath955 is a morphism in @xmath955 ( and even more ) , but the kernel in @xmath56 of a morphism in @xmath955 is not necessarily a morphism in @xmath955 .",
    "therefore , every epimorphism of comonoids is not a cokernel .",
    "once again , we call _ coideal epimorphisms _ , the epimorphisms that are cokernels .        the term _ coideal _ is already used in the literature , but stands for a ( coideal ) subobject @xmath960 ( or a monomorphism ) in @xmath56 of a comonoid @xmath60 such that its cokernel in @xmath56 is a morphism in @xmath955 .",
    "it is equivalent to ask that the quotient @xmath961 is a comonoid .",
    "we now relate this definition of ideal with the classical notion .",
    "let @xmath962^{\\iota } & a \\ar@{->>}[r]^{\\pi } & q}$ ] be an sequence in @xmath936 , exact in @xmath56 .",
    "denote by @xmath940 and @xmath963 the products of @xmath0 and @xmath953 respectively .",
    "the morphism @xmath964 is a morphism in @xmath936 , means that the following diagram commutes @xmath965^{\\pi { \\boxtimes}\\pi } \\ar[d]^{\\mu_a } &   q{\\boxtimes}q \\ar[d]^{\\mu_q } \\\\ a \\ar[r]^{\\pi } & q. } \\ ] ] let @xmath966 be the kernel of @xmath967 in @xmath56 .",
    "[ ideal - kernel ] let @xmath56 be a monoidal category such that the monoidal product @xmath57 preserves epimorphisms .",
    "a monomorphism @xmath951 is an ideal monomorphism if and only if the composite @xmath968 is equal to @xmath54 .",
    "@xmath972 from the hypothesis , we have that @xmath967 is an epimorphism .",
    "therefore , it is the cokernel of @xmath973 and by the universal property of the cokernel , there exists a morphism @xmath974 such that @xmath975 factors through @xmath967 .",
    "it is then straightforward to check that @xmath963 defines an associative product on @xmath953 .",
    "the extra assumption , that the monoidal product has to preserve epimorphisms , is verified in every cases studied in this paper . for a proof for this fact",
    ", we refer to proposition 1 , proposition 10 and section 5 of @xcite .",
    "suppose that we are working in an abelian category @xmath56 such that every short exact sequence splits , that is @xmath985^{\\iota } & a \\ar@{->>}[r]_{\\pi } & \\ar@{ .. >}@/_/[l]_{\\exists } q } $ ] or equivalently @xmath986 .",
    "once again , this condition is verified in every category studied here since they are categories of representations of finite groups over a field of characteristic @xmath54 .",
    "it is enough to prove that @xmath989 is the kernel of @xmath967 .",
    "we have the following commutative diagram @xmath990 & q { \\boxtimes}a \\ar@{->>}[r]^{q { \\boxtimes}\\pi } & q { \\boxtimes}q \\\\ a { \\boxtimes}(q \\oplus { \\underline{i } } )   \\ar@{>->}[r]^{i_1 } \\ar@{>->}[d ] \\ar@{ .. >>}[u]^{\\exists ! \\ , \\theta_2 } & a { \\boxtimes}a \\ar@{->>}[r]^{a { \\boxtimes}\\pi } \\ar@{->>}[u]_{\\pi { \\boxtimes}a } \\ar@{->>}[ur]^{\\pi { \\boxtimes}\\pi }   &   a { \\boxtimes}q \\ar@{->>}[u]_{\\pi { \\boxtimes}q } \\\\ a { \\boxtimes}(q \\oplus { \\underline{i } } ) \\oplus   ( q\\ \\oplus { \\underline{i } } ) { \\boxtimes}a \\ar[ur]^{i_1 \\oplus i_2 } & \\ar@{>->}[l ] ( q\\ \\oplus { \\underline{i } } ) { \\boxtimes}a \\ar@{>->}[u]_{i_2 } \\ar@{ .. >>}[r]^{\\exists ! \\ , \\theta_2 } & ( q \\oplus { \\underline{i}}){\\boxtimes}q , \\ar@{>->}[u ] } \\ ] ] where the two dotted arrows exist by the property of kernels applied to the first line and last column .",
    "since @xmath991 is by definition the image of the morphism @xmath992 , it remains to show that @xmath967 is the cokernel of @xmath992 .",
    "the assumption that every short exact sequence splits implies that the maps @xmath993 and @xmath994 are epimorphisms .",
    "it is then straightforward to check that @xmath995 is the cokernel of @xmath992 .",
    "since @xmath996 is the kernel of @xmath997 , there exists a morphism @xmath998 making the following diagram to commute @xmath999 \\ar[d]^{\\bar{\\mu } } & a{\\boxtimes}a \\ar[d]^{\\mu_a } & \\\\ { i \\ }",
    "\\ar@{>->}[r]^{\\iota } & a \\ar@{->>}[r]^{\\pi } & q.   } \\ ] ] hence , we get @xmath1000 .",
    "when the monoidal product is additive on the left and on the right , we have @xmath1001 and @xmath1002 . in this case , the notion of ideal corresponds to the classical one .",
    "+ dually , let @xmath1003^{\\iota } & c \\ar@{->>}[r]^{\\pi } & q } $ ] be a sequence in @xmath955 , exact in @xmath56",
    ". denote by @xmath1004 be the cokernel of @xmath1005 .",
    "note that when every short exact sequence splits , we have @xmath1006 .",
    "let @xmath56 be a monoidal category such that the monoidal product @xmath57 preserves monomorphisms .",
    "an epimorphism @xmath1007 is an coideal epimorphism if and only if the composite @xmath1008 is equal to @xmath54 .",
    "an object @xmath73 of @xmath56 is a _",
    "left module _ over a monoid @xmath0 if there exists a map @xmath1013 compatible with the product of @xmath0 .",
    "dually , there is a notion of _ right module_. and a compatible left and right action defines a _",
    "bimodule_.    at first sight , the biadditive case could lead to the following definition : @xmath952 is an ideal of @xmath0 if it is a bimodule over @xmath0 : @xmath1014 and @xmath1015 .",
    "the main problem with such a notion is that @xmath947 is not a monoid when @xmath57 is not biadditive .",
    "instead of that , one has to consider a linearized version of module .",
    "we have a similar notion on the right hand sight and a notion of _ multilinear bimodule_. if we use this language , @xmath952 is an ideal of @xmath0 if and only if @xmath952 a multilinear bimodule with the action induced by @xmath940 .",
    "the same notion arises from the work of d. quillen on ( co)homology theories @xcite .",
    "the coefficient for these theories are _ abelian group objects_. when one wants to make explicit quillen ( co)homology of monoids , these coefficients are exactly linear version of modules .",
    "we refer the reader to the paper of h.j .",
    "baues , m. jibladze and a. tonks @xcite for a complete description in the case of operads , or more generally when the monoidal product is additive only on one side .        following this categorical point of view , we define and make explicit the notions of _ ideal generated by _ and _ subcomonoid generated by_. + let @xmath1017 be a subobject of @xmath0 in @xmath56 , where @xmath0 is a monoid .",
    "we are going to consider the `` cokernel '' @xmath1018 of @xmath1019 in @xmath936 , that is the universal epimorphism of monoids such that the composite @xmath1020 vanishes .",
    "the resulting quotient monoid @xmath953 is the largest quotient of @xmath0 with relations in @xmath21 . +",
    "since our leitmotiv is to treat together ideals and quotient monoids , we would rather use the following presentation . consider the category @xmath1021 of sequences @xmath1022 in @xmath936 , exact in @xmath56 such that the composite @xmath1023 is equal to @xmath54 . since @xmath951 is the kernel of @xmath949 ,",
    "this last condition is equivalent to the existence of a morphism @xmath1024 in @xmath56 such that the following diagram commutes                if we dualize the previous arguments in the opposite category , we get the same kind of diagram but with @xmath60 comonoid instead of @xmath0 monoid .",
    "+ let @xmath1034 be a quotient of @xmath60 in @xmath56 , where @xmath60 is a comonoid .",
    "we aim to consider the largest subcomonoid of @xmath60 vanishing on @xmath232 .",
    "this notion is given by `` kernel '' @xmath1035 of @xmath1019 in @xmath955 , that is the universal monomorphism of comonoids such that the composite @xmath1036 is equal to @xmath54 .",
    "+ consider the category @xmath1021 of sequences @xmath1037 in @xmath955 , exact in @xmath56 such that the composite @xmath1038 is equal to @xmath54 .",
    "there exists a morphism @xmath1039 such that the diagram commutes                                i would like to thank marcelo aguiar to have shared with me his knowledge on manin s products .",
    "i am grateful to jean - louis loday , damien calaque and martin markl for useful discussions .",
    "it is a pleasure to thank anton korochkine for stimulating discussions about the counterexample of section  [ counterexample ] .",
    "+ i am grateful to the max planck institute for mathematics in bonn for the excellent working conditions i found there during my stay in may and june 2006 where i finished this paper .",

    "d. quillen , _ on the ( co- ) homology of commutative rings _ , applications of categorical algebra ( proc .",

    "xvii , new york , 1968 ) , amer .",
    "providence , r.i . , 1970 , pp ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> in this article we give a conceptual definition of manin products in any category endowed with two coherent monoidal products . </S>",
    "<S> this construction can be applied to associative algebras , non - symmetric operads , operads , colored operads , and properads presented by generators and relations . </S>",
    "<S> these two products , called black and white , are dual to each other under koszul duality functor . </S>",
    "<S> we study their properties and compute several examples of black and white products for operads . </S>",
    "<S> these products allow us to define natural operations on the chain complex defining cohomology theories . </S>",
    "<S> with these operations , we are able to prove that deligne s conjecture holds for a general class of operads and is not specific to the case of associative algebras . </S>",
    "<S> finally , we prove generalized versions of a few conjectures raised by m. aguiar and j .- l . </S>",
    "<S> loday related to the koszul property of operads defined by black products . </S>",
    "<S> these operads provide infinitely many examples for this generalized deligne s conjecture .    _ dedicated to jean - louis loday , on the occasion of his sixtieth birthday _ </S>"
  ]
}
